speaker: Dimitri
text: Thank you. you may leave now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did something happen?

speaker: Byleth
text: Was the report worrying?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Not really... There is just a problem I must now clean up. Do you know of Arianrhod? It is a fortress that also goes by the name of the Silver Maiden.

speaker: Byleth
text: I've heard of it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, I had thought I might have mentioned it before. It is a fortress city that is lauded as the strongest in the Kingdom.

speaker: Byleth
text: This is the first I'm hearing of it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Is that so? Arianrhod is a fortress city, lauded as the strongest in the Kingdom.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The land around Arianrhod was once entrusted to Count Rowe... When he turned to the Empire, the Silver Maiden went with him. Now, one after another the lords of each region are leaving the Empire at the call of the eastern lords... But I am sure the Empire has no plans to relinquish the Fortress City, given its strategic position on the front lines of their war with the Kingdom. Unless we can take back Arianrhod, the Kingdom will continually be attacked at its weakest points. I was thinking that we need to deal with it soon, and that we need to investigate the status of the enemy's force, but...

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am afraid so. We confirmed that troops departed the Imperial capital, headed for Arianrhod. If they are followed by a second and third batch of reinforcements, then the difficulty of taking back Arianrhod will increase exponentially. But, that does not mean we are entirely without recourse. I am just at a loss as to when the soldiers will arrive.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Right away? You never cease to amaze. Your answers always bring me joy. OK. Let's gather everyone immediately. We'll begin the war council for the departing troops.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not yet.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Indeed, I realized that was out of the blue. You have your own worries. Please accept my apologies. Though I do hope to deal with this sooner than later... If possible, I would like to ask you to take the lead. Speak with me again if you change your mind.

speaker: Hubert
text: It seems we are just in time. Any later, and Arianrhod may have been lost. Her Majesty was right to send me here.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hubert. So, you have come here in command of extra troops from the Imperial capital... I had hoped to take the fort while it was poorly defended, but now... Well, there is nothing to be done. We must defeat him and then take Arianrhod.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If I remember correctly, there should be devices somewhere that let you deactivate the traps. However... Arianrhod has been in Imperial hands for a while now. They may have changed how things work. But there's no point in dawdling. Let's just make a point to disable any devices we come across.

speaker: Hanneman
text: So what if they disable some old contraptions? It's no loss to us. The city's defenses are under my exclusive control.

speaker: Imperial General
text: No luck, buddy. All the city's defenses are under my control!

speaker: Dimitri
text: So, the system has been modified. The person operating the traps must be elsewhere...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Surprise reinforcements... We must defeat them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That should take care of the traps.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Good. We've cut them off from their reinforcements.

speaker: Hubert
text: I suppose you thought defeating the troops outside the castle first would demoralize the ones within. Not such a bad idea, honestly. But you failed to account for me.

speaker: Hanneman
text: For the sake of Edelgard, I shall take the liberty of helping.

speaker: Hanneman
text: In the end, I may not have gleaned your secret. Yet, even if I die, someone will follow my work, and another after that. Such is the way of scholarship.

speaker: Hanneman
text: If I die for this new Empire...then I have no...regrets.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor Hanneman... That should take care of the traps.

speaker: Manuela
text: I'd hate to kill someone I know...but I have no choice.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh dear, Professor. Fate can be so cruel. Spilling the blood of your students with your own hands... How can you carry on after that?

speaker: Manuela
text: You've grown into a fine, handsome man, Dimitri. Bit of a shame you've also become a violent beast. Men like you make the Silver Maiden cry.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Oh? I suppose it is a shame, Professor Manuela. Perhaps I should have appeared before you holding a bouquet of flowers, rather than the weapon that will end your life.

speaker: Manuela
text: So, the Silver Maiden...will be my last stage? Heh... You know, that's...that's not too bad.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor Manuela... At least we have stopped the reinforcements.

speaker: Hubert
text: Arianrhod is a crucial asset to the Empire. You will not pry it from our grasp.

speaker: Hubert
text: That's as far as I go... I'll withdraw... for now.

speaker: Hubert
text: First Gronder Field, and now here. You certainly have a talent for getting in our way.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Empire troops are withdrawing... This is it. We failed to get Hubert, but at least we recaptured Arianrhod. Let's clean up the wreckage and return to Garreg Mach. Well done, everyone! The day is ours!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Oh... It's you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you tired?

speaker: Byleth
text: A rare sight...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I think all of this work is just catching up with me. Just pretend that yawn never happened. By the way, I wanted to thank you for your help with the Arianrhod campaign the other day. You were exceptional. Your leadership was key in taking back Arianrhod safely.

speaker: Byleth
text: We all contributed.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Indeed, everyone gave their all for victory. I am always being saved by those around me, it seems.

speaker: Byleth
text: We got lucky.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do not be so modest.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It seems that after taking back Arianrhod, many things are changing within the Kingdom. Specifically, the lesser lords of the land surrounding Arianrhod have pledged vassalage to the Kingdom. The knights they possess may now be added to the Kingdom's army. And if that happens, I would like to leave them in your capable hands. Also... Ah, my apologies. Here I am, simply throwing one report after another at you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you overdoing it?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Perhaps. It is certainly true that I have been stuck in my quarters lately, dealing with more official business and other such tasks than ever before. But that is something I have been putting off for far too long. Though it is exhausting, filling in the blanks of five years and several months must be done. I am going to tackle them all, one at a time. That is one small part of my atonement. So, Professor... I have been doing all of the talking, but I assume you came here for a reason.

speaker: Byleth
text: I thought we could all celebrate our victory.

speaker: Dimitri
text: A victory celebration, you say?

speaker: Byleth
text: I intend to steal you away to the victory celebration.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Steal me away? That seems rather unnecessary... Hmm... A victory celebration, you say?

speaker: Dimitri
text: You know, this reminds me of that time I dragged you to the dining hall. Do you recall?

speaker: Byleth
text: I do.

speaker: Byleth
text: When was that?

speaker: Dimitri
text: If memory serves, that was after the mock battle between the houses... It was a wonderful time. We had just finished our mission, and we were invited to join in the celebration... You know, every once in a while, I do long to be part of the group as well. But do you think that it is really acceptable? For someone like me to quietly join in the merriment?

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone's waiting for you.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're thinking about it too much.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You really think so? Well, if you insist... Thank you, Professor. Now then, let's go. Together.

speaker: Shamir
text: ...And that is our situation.

speaker: Alois
text: But with so few knights, we'll surely--

speaker: Alois
text: Ah, Professor! Excellent timing.

speaker: Byleth
text: What's going on?

speaker: Shamir
text: Alois. You're not going to suggest we send students, are you?

speaker: Alois
text: I am, actually. Do you have a problem with that?

speaker: Shamir
text: I do. We can't send them out on a knight's mission without Rhea's blessing.

speaker: Alois
text: I'm sure I can get the go-ahead. I'll just say the students have a...new field training opportunity, or something like that. Besides, we'll be there. We're not going to let them get killed by pirates.

speaker: Byleth
text: What's this about pirates?

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Shamir
text: There are pirates causing havoc in the port of Derdriu, at the center of House Riegan's territory.

speaker: Alois
text: The Merchants' Association sent a request via the Eastern Church, asking for protection.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Eastern Church?

speaker: Shamir
text: You haven't heard of the Eastern Church? I suppose that's because they don't have much of a presence.

speaker: Alois
text: The Eastern Church controls eastern Fódlan. They don't have a standing army like we do. So, for incidents like this, they customarily ask for help from the Central Church.

speaker: Shamir
text: I imagine they want to contribute to make their presence known in the Alliance.

speaker: Alois
text: Be that as it may, we knights are quite busy. We don't have personnel to spare. Therefore, we're enlisting your help!

speaker: Shamir
text: You should have some experience dealing with pirates from your mercenary days, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: I may.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't remember.

speaker: Shamir
text: The students have dealt with pirates, so this shouldn't be a problem for them.

speaker: Alois
text: Come with us, won't you? Think of it as a training exercise. The Merchants' Association will reward us handsomely!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Shamir
text: We don't have time to lose. Let's take care of this quickly.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know if I should.

speaker: Alois
text: We're not leaving right away. Think on it.

speaker: Shamir
text: If you wish to join us, let me know.

speaker: Pirate Captain
text: Tremble before us! We are the great navy of Almyra! Resist and we'll burn this town to the ground!

speaker: Alois
text: The Almyran Navy... This is going to be tougher than I expected.

speaker: Claude
text: Huh? Sure, those look like Almyran ships, but I guarantee you they're just common pirates.

speaker: Shamir
text: They're obviously bluffing, but it seems to be working on the merchants. Shall we?

speaker: Merchant
text: It's the knights! Please, save us! We'll reward you handsomely!

speaker: Merchant
text: It would be a disaster if they attacked our shops. Please, don't let them into town!

speaker: Alois
text: We've got you. Leave it to the Knights of Seiros!

speaker: Pirate
text: Hahaha! Smash up the houses and trash the shops! Swipe anything that's not nailed down!

speaker: Merchant
text: Aah! If they attack the town, we won't even be able to pay the knights their reward...

speaker: Alois
text: That's not good. The pirates have got into town. We have to beat them, quick.

speaker: Shamir
text: The town is under attack. We have to move quickly.

speaker: Merchant
text: If the town gets damaged any further, we won't have much to offer as a reward...

speaker: Alois
text: Who cares about the reward? We're trying to protect the people!

speaker: Pirate
text: We are the ruthless barbarians of Almyra! Resist and pay the price!

speaker: Merchant
text: Oh dear... My wares! I'll be ruined! Please, do something quickly!

speaker: Alois
text: We are the Knights of Seiros, and we will not tolerate your violent villainy!

speaker: Claude
text: How could you commit such crimes in the name of Almyra? It's because of two-bit miscreants like you that Almyrans suffer so much hate!

speaker: Pirate Captain
text: Sh-shut up! Say what you will, we're the real navy of Almyra!

speaker: Alois
text: You're in charge of this sorry band, huh? We'll punish you in the name of the goddess!

speaker: Pirate Captain
text: Quiet, you! Time for a counter attack!

speaker: Shamir
text: Hate us all you want. We're just doing our job.

speaker: Pirate Captain
text: Idle prattle! You think you can beat us?

speaker: Claude
text: Ugh, what a pain that guy was. If you're going to pose as an Almyran, at least fight like one!

speaker: Alois
text: Well, that's over with. They were a lot more trouble than I expected.

speaker: Merchant
text: Thank you so much! Here's your reward. Please, take it.

speaker: Alois
text: Well, we got rid of them, but the town's not looking too pretty.

speaker: Merchant
text: Thank you. It's not much, but please take this as a reward.

speaker: Alois
text: Good gracious, I didn't expect it to become such a large-scale battle.

speaker: Shamir
text: It seems they caused the merchants unnecessary confusion by disguising themselves as Almyrans.

speaker: Alois
text: We taught the pirates a lesson though. That should calm them down a bit. I know this was more than you signed up for, but you really saved us!

speaker: Byleth
text: It was an interesting experience.

speaker: Byleth
text: It was good training.

speaker: Shamir
text: Thanks for your help. This can't be how you were expecting your day to go.

speaker: Alois
text: Patient and understanding, just like Captain Jeralt. We owe you a token of our appreciation, I think. Take the reward from the Merchants' Association. Share it with your students, if you like.

speaker: Byleth
text: Really?

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't accept this.

speaker: Shamir
text: Take it. We'll collect our reward from the Eastern Church. Besides, Alois could never keep it for himself.

speaker: Alois
text: Of course not! We knights serve as the sword and shield of Saint Seiros herself. We pride ourselves on our integrity! We reject all rewards that are not perfectly legitimate!

speaker: Shamir
text: In other words, he's a coward who would feel guilty and lose sleep over it.

speaker: Alois
text: Hmph.

speaker: Shamir
text: That's also one of his many merits.

speaker: Alois
text: Shamir, you don't mince words. Though it does seem like you've learned how to show a little respect.

speaker: Shamir
text: Must've learned that from you.

speaker: Alois
text: I don't remember teaching you that. Anyway, Professor, keep the compensation. I'd say you've earned it. Those merchants really needed your help. For all the buying and selling they do, they're not so good at trading blows!

speaker: Alois
text: Get it, trading blows? They... And merchants, they... Oh, forget it.

speaker: Shamir
text: We have to prepare for our next mission. Until next time, Professor.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Professor, do you have a moment?

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I would hear your opinion on our situation. Given our current fighting power, what sort of challenge do you expect we pose to the Empire? Do we have any hope of victory?

speaker: Byleth
text: Our preparations are lacking.

speaker: Byleth
text: The probability of victory is low.

speaker: Gilbert
text: So, we agree. However, in order to strengthen our forces, we--

speaker: Annette
text: Aaaargh! Ugh, why would anyone put a barrel here?!

speaker: Annette
text: Ow, that really smarts... Oh. Hello, Father.

speaker: Byleth
text: Father?

speaker: Gilbert
text: ... Another stupendous fall.

speaker: Annette
text: As though you care about my well-being. Anyway... Professor, I'm heading out for a bit.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Annette
text: I was thinking of going to visit my uncle.

speaker: Gilbert
text: To see my brother? Why is that, Annette?

speaker: Annette
text: I wanna ask him to entrust me with the Hero's Relic of House Dominic. The fight from here on out is gonna be tough. I need to do whatever I can to get stronger. The best thing we can do, as far as I can tell, is to have another Hero's Relic at our disposal.

speaker: Gilbert
text: You are not wrong, yet it will not be easy.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why's that?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Under pressure from Cornelia, House Dominic is maintaining a pro-Imperial stance. That makes us his enemy. Brother or no, he will not hand over a Hero's Relic to us.

speaker: Annette
text: But he's not a bad person... And we'll never know unless we ask, right? And Mother might be there too...

speaker: Gilbert
text: The Dominic region is, at present, enemy territory. There is no guarantee you can see them safely.

speaker: Annette
text: Fine. Be that way. It's not like I was planning to ask for your help, anyway. Professor, don't worry about me. I'll be back soon, and with a Relic, no less!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Annette! Wait! She never listens. So frustrating. However, if she were able to retrieve the Hero's Relic, it would prove a great boon to our forces. Perhaps I should prepare myself for the worst. I shall travel with Annette to see my brother. Professor, might I ask you to take on a task for me? It is entirely possible that we shall be captured in the Dominic region. In anticipation of that... I would ask that you wait outside the region, with an army at your command.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I cannot say with confidence that we will be able to bring back the Hero's Relic without issue. While it pains me to ask this favor of you, I must also thank you for accepting.

speaker: Byleth
text: I need some time...

speaker: Gilbert
text: I should be able to slow Annette's departure for a short while, at the least. Please join us when you can.

speaker: Annette
text: Uncle, I beg you! Please give me the Hero's Relic!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: Even in this land, the Empire's eye shines bright. To hand over such a weapon to you, our enemy, is unthinkable...

speaker: Gilbert
text: We are well aware. Brother, I beg you. For the sake of the Kingdom's revival...

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: I cannot. If it becomes known that I gave you aid, my lands will be annexed in a bitter instant.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Then we must relent. Annette, there is nothing for us here. We should go.

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: No. Letting you simply leave will invite accusations of collusion. I must take you as my hostages.

speaker: Gilbert
text: So... It has come to pass after all.

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: Annette, live here with me. You needn't return to that helpless band of rebels without a glimmer of hope for victory.

speaker: Annette
text: You're wrong! That will never happen, Uncle!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: Your mother is also here in this land. Do not dismiss my proposition so readily...

speaker: Annette
text: We can't afford to stay here. Father, we have to run!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Be calm, Annette. I assumed something like this would happen. If we do not come back, the professor will come to get us. We need but wait and keep faith...

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Our allies are being held in that stronghold in the southeast! Please, rescue them quickly!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: Ha! Right to the last, you hope to strike me down. In that case, I will also lay my cards on the table and commit all my resources to this fight!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Reinforcements?! That will make life more difficult.

speaker: Annette
text: Oh, thank goodness! Let's run, Father!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Annette, go. I will acquire the Hero's Relic, even if it means crossing blades with my brother.

speaker: Annette
text: I couldn't possibly leave you to do it alone! Father, please let me go with you!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: Even if you must do it by force, bring me Annette!

speaker: Annette
text: Gah... Leave me be!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: It's for your own good. You must understand, Annette.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I am soldier enough to admit I have lost this battle. Brother, I will lay down arms...

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: I have my own reason for not giving up. And the less I speak of it, the better...

speaker: Gilbert
text: My brother, I beg you...the Relic!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: I do not wish to repeat myself! If you want it that badly, slay me and claim it for your own

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: I have no wish to enact violence on you, Annette. Listen to me and do as I say.

speaker: Annette
text: I will not listen! I can't and I won't! There is somewhere I must return to!

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: So...this is it. I fought well, in the end. I doubt Cornelia will think I cooperated with you. Take the Hero's Relic and go. And in return...promise to restore the Kingdom.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Brother... I thank you.

speaker: Baron Dominic
text: And don't worry about your wife. Whatever happens, I swear I will protect her. When all of this is over, you had better return to her. Make sure victory is yours...Gustave.

speaker: Gilbert
text: You have my word.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I cannot tell you how grateful we are for your assistance.

speaker: Annette
text: I don't know what would have happened if not for you... And thanks to you, I got this!

speaker: Gilbert
text: The Magic hammer, Crusher... The Hero's Relic of House Dominic. My brother would not surrender such a Relic without a fight... I hope you understand.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Gilbert
text: House Dominic is one of the ten great bloodlines. Yet within the Kingdom, we are mere feudal lords. With the Empire growing in strength, Dominic must kneel. To do otherwise would be suicide. The western lords, and other rulers, are in the same situation. They all comply, albeit reluctantly. If we defeat the Empire, I hope the Kingdom will rise once more, under the banner of a legitimate king.

speaker: Annette
text: I hope so too. That's why we can't give up!

speaker: Gilbert
text: To that end, Professor, we will require your help. I hope we can continue depending on you.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll do what I can.

speaker: Byleth
text: You can count on me.

speaker: Annette
text: Don't worry! We won't make you do all the hard work by yourself. I'll give it my all too! Speaking of... I'm gonna get straight to training!

speaker: Annette
text: Gaaaaaah! Why would someone put a dumb wooden box here?!

speaker: Gilbert
text: And please, look after my daughter as well.
There’s no reason to feign ignorance. I know all about you!

speaker: Marianne
text: Wh-what are you talking about?
Just come here!

speaker: Marianne
text: Professor! Help!
Don’t interfere. Just hand the girl over to me.

speaker: Byleth
text: Never.
I’m telling you this for your own good. You’re putting yourself in danger by associating with her.

Do you know of the Wandering Beast stalking in the wood in the Edmund territory? It is said that it attacks people every night and drags them off to feast. The true identity of the Wandering Beast... Is that girl right there!

speaker: Marianne
text: No! I would never...

speaker: Byleth
text: Get out of here!
No matter. I’ll get the evidence I need...

speaker: Marianne
text: My apologies for you getting involved in that...

speaker: Byleth
text: What happened?

speaker: Marianne
text: In truth, that man has been following me ever since my father disappeared... He’s a Crest scholar.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why is he following you?

speaker: Marianne
text: The Crest that my father bore and was passed down to me... It was... Maurice’s Crest.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maurice’s Crest?

speaker: Marianne
text: Yes. It’s also known as...the Crest of the Beast... It’s said there were once 12 heroes who saved Fódlan. There was the King of Liberation, Nemesis...the 10 Elites, and finally...Maurice. One day, Maurice suddenly transformed into a hideous beast and slaughtered innocent people. It was like when Miklan of House Gautier turned into a Black Beast. The negative energy dwelling within his Crest turned Maurice into a monster. The people of Fódlan grew to despise him, and he was stripped of his honor. His whole clan was conquered, and it was believed that his bloodline had vanished... But even now, there exist a few descendants who have inherited Maurice’s Crest, and his curse. My family line...is one of them. Maurice’s Crest is a symbol of disaster. Anyone who comes in contact with it is met with great misfortune. Those who carry the Crest became beasts at night and slaughter innocent people.

speaker: Byleth
text: What that man mentioned earlier...

speaker: Marianne
text: Yes, the rumor about the Wandering Beast in the woods... People are saying the creature is similar in appearance to Maurice’s bestial form.

speaker: Byleth
text: If it’s defeated, wouldn’t the rumor be dispelled?

speaker: Marianne
text: That may be true but...I doubt I could do it on my own. If you and some of the other students came with me though...

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Marianne
text: Thank you! But, um... Promise you won't tell anyone about my Crest?

speaker: Marianne
text: I'm sorry to have to ask...but thank you!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll think about it.

speaker: Marianne
text: It is my personal matter, so I can't expect you to get involved. But if you change your mind...I'll be waiting.

speaker: Marianne
text: A-are you really the Wandering Beast that people talk about?

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: You... Do you bear our Crest? For what purpose did you come here?

speaker: Marianne
text: Our Crest? Does that mean...

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: It appears that your presence has been detected by bloodthirsty Demonic Beasts...

speaker: Marianne
text: Demonic Beasts? Everyone... Please move carefully!

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: This forest is the den of Demonic Beasts. You will be lucky to make it out alive.

speaker: Marianne
text: You saved me, Professor... Thank you. The Wandering Beast's true form... Could it be... Oh! Sorry! I need to focus on the fight!

speaker: Marianne
text: Argh! I'm...not strong enough...

speaker: Marianne
text: Dear Goddess... My soul is yours to take...

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: My beastly blood is roused... You will not be able to stop me!

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: Nothing will stop me...from feasting upon your flesh and blood!

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: That sword... It's the sword of the king! Are you the one who can liberate me?!

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: Nothing will stop me...from feasting upon your flesh and blood!

speaker: Marianne
text: No! I won't let you!

speaker: Claude
text: That looks just like Miklan's Black Beast... Could a Hero's Relic be at fault?

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: Hero... That is a word that takes me back.

speaker: Claude
text: Takes you back? You... Are you...

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: After so long, I cannot speak of it.

speaker: Wandering Beast
text: Well done... Finally, this nightmare of a thousand years is at its end. Oh, inheritor of my Crest...if this body is to decay, then the sword... I leave it to you...

speaker: Marianne
text: I still can’t believe what we saw in that forest... The Wandering Beast’s eviscerated body... Only human bones and this sword remaining.

speaker: Marianne
text: Surely the creature’s true identity was...

speaker: Crest Scholar
text: I’m sorry...

speaker: Marianne
text: You again?

speaker: Crest Scholar
text: I heard rumor that the Wandering Beast was slain, but do you really believe that frees you of suspicion? Without proof that it was slain, the argument that you are not a beast does not stand. Furthermore, I... Huh? Oh! That sword!

speaker: Marianne
text: When the Wandering Beast was defeated, this sword...

speaker: Crest Scholar
text: It’s unmistakable! Carved into that sword’s Crest stone is Maurice’s Crest! But how would the lost Magic Blade end up with the Wandering Beast? According to what I know of Maurice’s story, he didn’t let go of the sword until the very end. That must mean... I see. So that’s what happened... My apologies, it seems I was mistaken. I must be going.

speaker: Marianne
text: So the Wandering Beast was...

speaker: Byleth
text: Maurice himself.

speaker: Marianne
text: He was roaming the dark woods for over a thousand years, suffering for his murderous past.

speaker: Byleth
text: Someone who bears the Crest of the Beast.

speaker: Marianne
text: No, I’m sure that was Maurice himself. He was roaming the dark woods for over a thousand years, suffering for his murderous past.

speaker: Byleth
text: Good thing you were able to put an end to it.

speaker: Marianne
text: It’s true... And because of that, I feel as though...my curse has been lifted. The blood of a beast no longer flows through me. I feel human for once.

speaker: Marianne
text: Thank you, Professor. I couldn’t have done it on my own. Without your help, I would never have found peace. I’ll do anything I can to repay my debt to you!

speaker: Flayn
text: Brother, please wait!

speaker: Seteth
text: For the last time, Flayn, the answer is no.

speaker: Flayn
text: You are departing for the Rhodos Coast, are you not? I must come!

speaker: Seteth
text: You will do no such thing. I am not going there to pay respects at the cemetery, but to do battle. With you there, I will be beside myself with worry. It will be easier for me to fight if I know you are safe.

speaker: Flayn
text: But...I must!

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor! You have come at just the right time.

speaker: Byleth
text: What's going on?

speaker: Flayn
text: Surely it must be fate that you have appeared at a time of my greatest need!

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't like the sound of that...

speaker: Flayn
text: I only wish to make a small request.

speaker: Flayn
text: My dear brother is about to set forth on a most dangerous mission.

speaker: Byleth
text: A mission?

speaker: Seteth
text: Indeed. The Western Church is attempting to seize sacred ground by force. Though they now have a new bishop, it seems that a radical faction has emerged to resist the new order. We cannot allow the holy artifacts enshrined there to fall into their hands.

speaker: Flayn
text: I, too, wish to be of use to the church! And I do admit I am terribly worried about my brother. No matter my protests, he will not allow me to come. Professor, this is where you can help. Will you accompany us both on this expedition?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Flayn
text: If you are there to protect me, my brother's fears will be allayed. Isn't that right, Brother?

speaker: Seteth
text: I suppose your aid would indeed be useful, yes.

speaker: Flayn
text: I knew it! Please, Professor, will you join us?

speaker: Byleth
text: Very well.

speaker: Flayn
text: Wonderful. Let us depart at once!

speaker: Byleth
text: Not right now.

speaker: Flayn
text: Please tend to your errands promptly. Then you will come along with us, yes?

speaker: Seteth
text: There is still time before we must depart. If you are able to accompany us, let me know.

speaker: Priest
text: You heretics, who defile our goddess! The sacred coast belongs to us, the Western Church!

speaker: Seteth
text: You are the heretics! Begone from here at once!

speaker: Priest
text: Silence, dog of the apostate! Prepare to receive our righteous blades!

speaker: Seteth
text: I will recapture the monument. Everyone else should focus on removing the surrounding enemies.

speaker: Flayn
text: Wait, Brother! I shall accompany you!

speaker: Flayn
text: Leave! Let Mother rest in peace!

speaker: Priest
text: It is our duty to worship Saint Cichol! We will not allow heretics to come near!

speaker: Priest
text: It's like the goddess herself commanded me to live... I must offer her my thanks.

speaker: Seteth
text: The goddess doesn't want your thanks!

speaker: Priest
text: But it was...for the sake of the goddess...

speaker: Priest
text: The goddess protects us! We will never yield to the likes of you!

speaker: Priest
text: I got away, thanks to the protection of the goddess!

speaker: Seteth
text: Insufferable arrogance! We'll have to send someone after them...

speaker: Priest
text: Goddess... Have you abandoned us?

speaker: Priest
text: Heretics! Prepare to taste the power of the true servants of the goddess!

speaker: Priest
text: We're no match for them... Brothers... Retreat...

speaker: Seteth
text: Do you dare compound your crimes further? There will be no escape for you!

speaker: Seteth
text: That is the last of them. Flayn...will you place some flowers at the monument?

speaker: Flayn
text: Of course, Brother. That is what I came here to do.

speaker: Flayn
text: This place... is very precious to me... please... protected it... for me...

speaker: Seteth
text: I must pull back... I leave the rest to you. Do not let them take this position.

speaker: Seteth
text: Your assistance is most appreciated. I can only hope that the Western Church will now see reason and abandon this place. But just to be safe, I have retrieved the holy artifacts. We cannot risk them falling into their hands. I will entrust them to you. I must confess, despite the situation, it was a pleasure to return here. This coast has a certain sentimental significance to my sister and me.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sentimental significance?

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes. This stone monument is not merely here to commemorate Saint Cichol. It is also the grave of my wife.

speaker: Flayn
text: You are safe now, Mother. Finally, you may find peace.

speaker: Byleth
text: Your mother is also buried here?

speaker: Seteth
text: I suppose you have earned the right to know. But this must remain between us. Flayn is actually my daughter. My late wife and her mother are the same person.

speaker: Byleth
text: I had no idea.

speaker: Seteth
text: Due to certain...circumstances, it is more convenient for us to masquerade as siblings for the time being.

speaker: Byleth
text: I suspected as much.

speaker: Seteth
text: And here I thought we had hidden it skillfully.

speaker: Seteth
text: There are many who would seek to harm Flayn due to the unique blood she bears. Falsifying her identity is necessary to conceal her from such individuals. Mercifully, I happen to look quite young for my age. We make rather convincing siblings, do we not?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's true enough.

speaker: Byleth
text: If you say so.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm. I was certain our cover was adequate.

speaker: Flayn
text: Mother loved the coast so much. She and I came here together often. Fishing was her favorite pastime. I used to sit and watch while she cast her line.

speaker: Seteth
text: I remember it fondly. You did so love to eat the fish she caught, as well.

speaker: Flayn
text: Fish is my favorite food, it is true. Due in no small part to Mother.

speaker: Seteth
text: I still come here to fish, from time to time, using the skills my wife taught me. It reminds me how deeply I appreciate those years... and how I wish I could return to them.

speaker: Flayn
text: We cannot turn back the clock, Father. We must live our lives fully, in the present moment.

speaker: Seteth
text: You're right. That is what she always said, isn't it? Dwell too much on the past, and you may be unable to move forward. Come, then. Let us return home.

speaker: Flayn
text: Good-bye, Mother. I love you. I shall bring flowers again for you next time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Has something happened?

speaker: Byleth
text: What's on your mind?

speaker: Dedue
text: Oh–it's you, Professor. Since you are here, I have a favor to ask.

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness. You've returned.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Sorry to keep you waiting, Dedue. I'm glad you're here as well, Professor. I want you both to hear this. Dedue is already aware, but you should know there's been an uprising in the Duscur region, in the western part of the Kingdom.

speaker: Byleth
text: An uprising in Duscur? Why?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue... Would you like me to explain?

speaker: Dedue
text: No. It should be me.  I am from Duscur. It lies just beyond the mountains on the northwestern border of Faerghus. But the people of Duscur no longer live there. The land was burned to ashes by the army of Faerghus. All of the people were slaughtered.  This was our punishment for the crime of regicide.

speaker: Dedue
text: The barren expanse that was once Duscur is now controlled by a Kingdom noble. But Duscur survivors, such as myself, still exist outside the region. This uprising is most likely the work of such survivors, seeking to reclaim their homeland.

speaker: Dimitri
text: A request for aid was sent from Viscount Kleiman to the Kingdom capital and the church. He is the one who rules over that region at present. For now, the lords surrounding the Duscur region have sent their armies to help suppress the uprising. However...

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Byleth
text: Are they short on troops?

speaker: Dimitri
text: They have sufficient troops, and strong ones at that. My worry is that there will be more unwarranted death. There have always been many in the Kingdom's army who believe the people of Duscur our foes, and hate them because of it. You would think they'd refrain from squashing the rebels out of political expediency...but I doubt that will be the case. If the Kingdom's army and the rebel forces of Duscur collide, there is no doubt that the rebel forces will be annihilated. I'm afraid...that's the best case scenario. It could also turn into complete and bloody chaos for both sides.

speaker: Dedue
text: Indeed.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Which brings me to my news. I have just now received the permission I requested from the church.

speaker: Byleth
text: Permission for what?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I asked the church to deploy our class to help handle the situation.

speaker: Dedue
text: So we may go?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Not so fast. We still have a responsibility as students of the academy, after all. The only one who can truly make the decision as to whether or not we go is our professor. So... What do you say?

speaker: Byleth
text: Very well.

speaker: Dedue
text: You have my most sincere gratitude.

speaker: Dimitri
text: And mine as well. But we must move fast. I will go and alert the others.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let me think about it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I know this was sudden, but given the situation, I'm afraid there isn't much time to ponder. When you've decided, please speak with me right away.

speaker: Dedue
text: Please, decide quickly.

speaker: Dedue
text: The Kingdom's vanguard has already arrived. Just as we'd feared, they far outclass the Duscur forces. We cannot stand by and allow another massacre. But we cannot obstruct the Faerghus army, either. Our best hope is to force the troops of Duscur to withdraw before the Kingdom soldiers get to them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The main body of the Kingdom's army is bound to arrive soon. Until then, let's aim to quell this uprising ourselves. Once the main force arrives, we'll be out of options. We must move fast.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It seems the church and the Kingdom troops are not working together. My head hurts just thinking about it, but we may be able to use that. First, let's push Duscur to retreat. The Kingdom might then also withdraw without a fight.

speaker: Dedue
text: Let us be quick about it.

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: Our grudge will not be settled...until all of you are dead and buried!

speaker: Kingdom General
text: Split up between the east and the west, and advance! That'll put the squeeze on those Duscur animals in a hurry!

speaker: Dedue
text: They are moving out. Time is of the essence, now.

speaker: Kingdom General
text: Seems this area's done already. All right, men! Fall back!

speaker: Kingdom General
text: OK, looks like they're already under control. Let's head back now.

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: We're here to quell this rebellion, starting now. Hunt down those filthy beasts, and give no quarter!

speaker: Dedue
text: The main army has arrived. We stand no chance against those numbers. We took too long. It is all over...

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: I give my all for our goal! You will die here!

speaker: Dedue
text: Go now if you value your life.

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: But aren't you with Faerghus? In any case... Thank you.

speaker: Dedue
text: You can still get out of here. Run.

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: You're not going to kill us?! Well, I won't wait here to find out. I'm leaving!

speaker: Dedue
text: Safely away.

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: I won't allow it... If only you dastards weren't here...

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: I'll have your life for atonement, king slayer!

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: Heretics... What is it you think...we have done?

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Filthy Duscur demons...

speaker: Duscur Soldier
text: Revenge for my brothers...even at the cost of death...

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Not content with slaying His Majesty, you thought to revolt?! Pathetic!

speaker: Duscur General
text: You...are a man of Duscur. How can you make friends with our hated foes? Is it possible that you've lost your Duscur spirit?

speaker: Dedue
text: Are you finished?

speaker: Duscur General
text: Now, this is a windfall... Who knew we'd meet our sworn enemy here!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Sworn enemy? Well, I cannot disagree.

speaker: Duscur General
text: We will slay you and topple Faerghus! That way, for the first time in ages...Duscur can be reborn!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hmph.

speaker: Duscur General
text: Is this...how our dream ends...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will check the status of the Kingdom troops. Dedue, I leave the Duscur army to you.

speaker: Dedue
text: Yes, Your Highness. Please be careful.

speaker: Duscur General
text: Why save us?

speaker: Dedue
text: I will not abide the needless death of my own people.

speaker: Duscur General
text: You must know that as long as there is breath in me, I will fight.

speaker: Dedue
text: Then fight, and be defeated. But so long as you pose no threat to His Highness, I will not end your life.

speaker: Duscur General
text: Idealistic fool. We will not relent. Not until we've taken back the homeland you monsters stole from us!

speaker: Dedue
text: I share the same sentiment.

speaker: Duscur General
text: You? Who sold his soul for Faerghus?

speaker: Dedue
text: His Highness has promised the people of Duscur a home. His will be a kingdom that is proud to harbor the blood of both Faerghus and Duscur.

speaker: Duscur General
text: That's impossible. Don't be naive.

speaker: Dedue
text: Believe what you will. But Faerghus will change under his reign. That is my firm belief.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Kingdom army has retreated to the fortress. There should be no further danger.

speaker: Duscur General
text: Prince of Faerghus! You monster!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Can you still run? Then I suggest you do so now.

speaker: Dedue
text: May our paths cross again.

speaker: Duscur General
text: I certainly hope not. But remember this one thing. The people of Duscur never forget their grudges. Nor do they fail to honor favors.

speaker: Dedue
text: Thank you, Your Highness, for accommodating my selfish request.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Think nothing of it. This was something I wished for, as well. If you must give thanks, direct it at the church for allowing us to join the battle, and to our professor for leading the charge. It's about time we headed back. The professor and the others are waiting.

speaker: Dedue
text: I am right behind you.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey, Professor. I might have to go back home for a little while.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is someone in your family sick?

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh no, nothing like that.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there some kind of emergency?

speaker: Hilda
text: Well, that's one way of putting it...

speaker: Hilda
text: The Almyran forces are causing trouble at Fódlan's Locket. Oh, do you know where that is? Well, the mountain range that separates the Alliance from Almyra is called Fódlan's Throat. There's a fortress right on top of the throat, and they call that Fódlan's Locket.

speaker: Byleth
text: So, you're going to help defend it?

speaker: Hilda
text: Well, yeah, you could say that. I'm sure my brother would be able to handle them on his own. But he said he really wants me to help out. I guess he's a bit tired out from all his hard work. Anyway, our dad's not as sprightly as he used to be. He's not up for a fight. Apparently it would look bad if we left it to the retainers. I really, really don't want to go, but I guess I have to.

speaker: Cyril
text: Heya, Hilda. I...well, I wasn't trying to eavesdrop, but I heard ya talking...

speaker: Hilda
text: Hm? Oh, what's up, Cyril?

speaker: Cyril
text: You're gonna fight the Almyrans, yeah?

speaker: Hilda
text: Yes. But it's nothing you need to worry about, Cyril.

speaker: Cyril
text: It's not that. I was just wondering if...if maybe I could maybe go along with ya?

speaker: Hilda
text: But--you'd be fighting people from your homeland. Do you really want to do that?

speaker: Cyril
text: None of 'em would remember me anyway... It's just that...I got captured in the battle at the Locket, and that's how I ended up here. So I'm kinda worried that other kids who lose their folks might not be so lucky.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Cyril
text: Before Lady Rhea took me in, I had a real hard time as a servant of House Goneril.

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm sorry to hear that. But it's not like I'll go around snapping up Almyran children.

speaker: Cyril
text: That's good, but I just... I want to see things for myself, so I know...that everything's OK.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hm. Well then, let's go together! Oh, would you want to join us, Professor? My brother will be there, but I'm a little scared about fighting all those fierce Almyrans...

speaker: Cyril
text: If you could come too, it would be really great. We'd all feel way safer if you did.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll come with you.

speaker: Hilda
text: Great! I know we'll be OK if you're there! Let's head out right away.

speaker: Cyril
text: I'll go and get ready too.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll think it over.

speaker: Hilda
text: You're a real tease, Professor. I know you're going to come along in the end. But we can't wait long, so hurry up on deciding.

speaker: Hilda
text: Most of our allies have fallen. My big brother and I can probably handle this though...

speaker: Goneril Soldier
text: Hilda! Glad you made it! Lord Holst has been afflicted with a sudden illness and couldn't come...

speaker: Hilda
text: He's not here?! Oh... I'm sorry. You must have been absolutely terrified. It's OK though! I brought along someone who can definitely help us! That's you, Professor. Please help us save our allies and protect Fódlan's Locket.

speaker: Cyril
text: Good thing I knew about this back road, huh? We oughta be able to help our friends from here.

speaker: Goneril Soldier
text: Support! We're saved!

speaker: Goneril Soldier
text: Argh... No help came...

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh no! They got one...but we can still rescue the others!

speaker: Goneril Soldier
text: We must defend here, or else... Our house... The Alliance...

speaker: Hilda
text: All our allied troops were wiped out. We won't be able to defend this place.

speaker: Hilda
text: Ah, things are looking up. Let's keep going, and save the others!

speaker: Hilda
text: We did it somehow. Cyril, Professor--thank you.

speaker: Cyril
text: You bet.

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm gonna drop by my family's estate and complain to my brother a bit. You two should head back.

speaker: Cyril
text: They aren't really trying to cross Fódlan's Throat. I'm not saying they're not serious, but fights like this one aren't really invasions.

speaker: Byleth
text: Then what are they doing?

speaker: Cyril
text: They just start fights like this sometimes. It's so they can show off how strong they are. I think it's pretty dumb. I mean, people are getting killed! And why? So some guy can think he's tough? After every fight, they do a big feast, and everybody eats and dances and there's music... It's supposed to honor the dead, but I figure they just like to make noise. I think they're all idiots, but if I'm real honest, it wasn't the worst way to live life.

speaker: Byleth
text: Feeling homesick?

speaker: Cyril
text: Nah, I'm where I belong now, and I don't really like Almyra. If they wanna show how tough they are, then they oughta look after kids who've lost their parents.

speaker: Hilda
text: Whew, I'm tired. Professor, Cyril, thanks for all your help.

speaker: Cyril
text: You get a chance to see your brother?

speaker: Hilda
text: I did. Though I think I'd be better off otherwise. He was horribly ill, for one thing. He looked so pale and haggard. Apparently he'd eaten a bad mushroom before the battle and it made him horribly sick. What an idiot. Anyway, when I told him we'd handled the Almyran situation, he was just gushing with praise. I tried telling him that it wasn't all me, but he didn't even listen.

speaker: Byleth
text: Weren't you glad to get praise from your brother?

speaker: Hilda
text: That did feel pretty good, I'll admit. But then things got awkward. He started trying to pawn off his whole inheritance. I told him I wanted none of it! Eventually he settled for foisting this thing on me. Do you know what it is?

speaker: Cyril
text: One heck of an axe. He gave it to ya?

speaker: Hilda
text: Yes. It's a magic axe called Freikugel. It's the Hero's Relic of House Goneril. He said that I should have it, since the Crest I bear will allow me to wield it. He was so insistent, I eventually relented. But I don't think I can be responsible for something so precious. Hey, Professor... Why don't you take it instead?

speaker: Byleth
text: You should keep it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Hilda
text: Heroes' Relics contain terrifying power. They're beyond the capabilities of a novice like me. You're the only person I trust to take care of it. Please, help me out here!

speaker: Byleth
text: If you're sure...

speaker: Byleth
text: If you really think it's necessary...

speaker: Hilda
text: Thank you so much! I honestly didn't know what I was going to do with this thing! A big scary axe is not my style. Plus, look closely--parts of the axe are pulsating, like it's alive! How gross is that? But I'll use it if you tell me to, Professor. Or you can get somebody else to wield it, if you like. It's all up to you now!

speaker: Cyril
text: That Hilda... She really is something.

speaker: Catherine
text: There you are. I have a request for you.

speaker: Byleth
text: A request?

speaker: Catherine
text: It has to do with that plot to assassinate Lady Rhea. The bishop leading the Western Church was somehow involved.

speaker: Catherine
text: And speaking of the Western Church, there was also that incident in which one of the more extreme factions tried to occupy sacred land.

speaker: Catherine
text: Enough is enough, so now the Knights of Seiros have been tasked with putting the bishop down. I thought you and your students could come with us.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why would you want us to help?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why for such an important mission?

speaker: Catherine
text: Because you wield the Sword of the Creator. Lady Rhea is going to personally execute the bishop. I have been appointed as her guard. I want your help protecting her. So what do you say? Will you come?

speaker: Ashe
text: Um, excuse me! I’d like to come along.

speaker: Catherine
text: Ashe! You were listening in? It’s not up to you whether you can “come along.”

speaker: Ashe
text: Please, this is important to me.

speaker: Catherine
text: Your adoptive father, Lord Lonato, had connections to the Western Church. I understand that you want answers. But our objective is to punish, not to investigate. We can’t let you jeopardize the mission.

speaker: Ashe
text: I won’t get in the way, I promise!

speaker: Catherine
text: Hm... What do you say, Professor? Keep in mind we would be bringing the whole class, not just Ashe.

speaker: Byleth
text: We’ll go.

speaker: Ashe
text: Thank you so much.

speaker: Catherine
text: OK. I guess it’s fine. Get ready, then.

speaker: Byleth
text: I’m not sure.

speaker: Catherine
text: Hm. Well, can’t hurt to wait a bit, I suppose. Do let me know when you finish your preparations. This is an important mission.

speaker: Bishop
text: There she is -- The sneaky little witch trying to pass herself off as the goddess’s envoy... Archbishop Rhea! I’ll bring judgment upon you in the goddess’s stead!

speaker: Catherine
text: They’re using the fog as cover to ambush us. What a cheap ploy.

speaker: Rhea
text: It won’t do any good to get annoyed, Catherine. That voice... We’re up against a faction of bishops.

speaker: Catherine
text: They’ve shown themselves, at least, so we won’t have to go to the trouble of finding them. All right. You got a death wish? Come at me! You really want to fight against Thunder Catherine?

speaker: Catherine
text: Please, Professor. Don’t let Lady Rhea get hurt. Our mission isn’t just to wipe out all the enemies, but also to protect Lady Rhea. Ready?

speaker: Ashe
text: Lady Rhea!

speaker: Catherine
text: Hold the line! Don't let them attack Lady Rhea again.

speaker: Rhea
text: They have received reinforcements, and it seems the priests are calling them over.

speaker: Ashe
text: Then we'll just have to take them out!

speaker: Rhea
text: It seems that taking out the priest has stopped the reinforcements coming over here. We should be able to stop the reinforcements coming from the other side by taking care of the other priest.

speaker: Rhea
text: They will not be able to send any more troops now. Let us sweep up the stragglers.

speaker: Catherine
text: Good work, Lady Rhea! Let's round 'em up and cut 'em down.

speaker: Bishop
text: Apostates will suffer the punishment of the goddess!

speaker: Ashe
text: Lonato’s blood is on your hands…

speaker: Bishop
text: Were you Lord Lonato’s page or something? Indeed, he was a devout believer. All we did was provide Lord Lonato salvation from his misery!

speaker: Ashe
text: Salvation?! You used him and threw him away!

speaker: Bishop
text: Apostates! You sully the name of the goddess!

speaker: Rhea
text: You are the apostates! The goddess is with me!

speaker: Rhea
text: Goddess, have mercy. Forgive them their sins, and save their souls...

speaker: Catherine
text: It would have been better if we’d captured the bishop. But they didn’t make it easy for us. What now, Lady Rhea?

speaker: Rhea
text: We must go to the headquarters of the Western Church. Perhaps there is still someone there who knows what has transpired.

speaker: Ashe
text: Let us help too. It may not be much, but we’ll do whatever we can!

speaker: Rhea
text: I am sure you will be a great help. I am glad to have you by my side.

speaker: Catherine
text: Thanks, Professor. I really appreciated your help with the investigation. That’s it for today. Head back to Garreg Mach. The church will have to choose a new bishop, and do whatever else is necessary to rebuild the Western Church. Lady Rhea is grateful to all of you. She said she would send along a reward. You should feel very proud. Receiving a gift directly from Lady Rhea is exceedingly rare. Still. That was a real mess, huh? For them to come out and charge us so boldly...

speaker: Byleth
text: I’m glad we made it out.

speaker: Catherine
text: As am I. We kept Lady Rhea safe, thanks to you.

speaker: Byleth
text: I thought we were doomed.

speaker: Catherine
text: I did too. But we made it out somehow, thanks to you.

speaker: Catherine
text: Hey, where did Ashe go? I haven’t seen him for a while.

speaker: Byleth
text: No idea.

speaker: Catherine
text: Could he still be back there? I’m glad he’s so dedicated to his work, but...

speaker: Byleth
text: He couldn’t still be back there, could he?

speaker: Catherine
text: That may be it. I hope he’s not getting in the way...

speaker: Catherine
text: There you are, Ashe. We were just talking about...

speaker: Catherine
text: Why the brooding expression? Hey, what’s that bundle of papers in your hand?

speaker: Ashe
text: This was given to me. It has to do with my family.

speaker: Byleth
text: Given to you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is this about Lord Lonato?

speaker: Ashe
text: I haven’t finished reading it all yet. But I think it might offer some clues about something I need to know. Professor, Catherine. Thank you for letting me come with you on this mission. I’d better get ready to go.

speaker: Catherine
text: It’s a little painful to watch... I do hope that those papers, whatever they are, will help him get over his past. I suppose it’s time for us to start heading back to the monastery.

speaker: Manuela
text: It's raining, Professor. On rainy days, the wound I got from the Death Knight hurts like fire. Every time it aches, I get angry. You understand, yeah? I'm sure they had their reasons to kidnap Flayn, but still... Did they really need to stab me? What'd I have to do with it?! They ruined my beautiful, porcelain skin. Worse, they took off before I could stab them back. So rude.

speaker: Hanneman
text: That's rather enough, Manuela. Cease your moaning and give the professor a break.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh, stuff it, Hanneman. Unlike you, the professor has a big heart and listens to me talk about any problem I have.

speaker: Hanneman
text: More likely, your incessant ramblings offer no chance to interrupt.

speaker: Manuela
text: Is that true, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Manuela isn't bothering me.

speaker: Manuela
text: I knew it. You listen to me because you care about me, don't you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Professor Hanneman is right.

speaker: Hanneman
text: You heard that, didn't you, Manuela? You are bothering the professor.

speaker: Manuela
text: Go away, Hanneman! Leave us alone. And stop making me shout! it causes the old wound to hurt again.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Then perhaps you'd best stay quiet. Keep your emotions in check, I'd say.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's stop this now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's all get along.

speaker: Manuela
text: Don't worry, Professor. We do this all the time.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Indeed, Manuela and I do not mix well. Been true for years. That said, if it were up to me, I would prefer speaking to her in a calmer manner.

speaker: Manuela
text: It's not like I enjoy bickering with you. So maybe keep your mouth shut more often.

speaker: Hanneman
text: I state that which needs to be heard! For example--

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's stop this now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's all get along.

speaker: Manuela
text: I'm sorry. I couldn't help it...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Same, same. Apologies. I am here because I have new information on the Death Knight's hiding place.

speaker: Manuela
text: What? Really?! You could have started with that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Several students have reported possible sightings on the western edge of the Sealed Forest. While the authenticity of these reports has yet to be verified, it is still a very real possibility. I was thinking I would report this to Seteth as a precaution.

speaker: Manuela
text: What? Why? We can't be slow! He's going to get away!

speaker: Hanneman
text: Protocol on this matter requires reporting to Seteth, then Lady Rhea, then...

speaker: Manuela
text: Professor, let's leave this old geezer behind and get going!

speaker: Hanneman
text: Old geezer? I am barely 15 years your senior! I will not hear such--

speaker: Manuela
text: Stop talking! Let's gather a team and get going!

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree.

speaker: Manuela
text: I'll go scout ahead. I'm coming for you, Death Knight!

speaker: Hanneman
text: Manuela, wait! It would not do to get yourself killed without someone to avenge you!

speaker: Byleth
text: Not yet...

speaker: Manuela
text: Well, I'm going ahead anyway. You can't stop me.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Manuela, take a moment. You must prepare before heading out! Professor, please let me know as soon as you can if you could join us.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Manuela's in a tough spot, Professor. Even if she's only got herself to blame, we cannot abandon her.

speaker: Bandit Leader
text: Heh... We have plenty of visitors today. Let's stop their annoying rescue attempt!

speaker: Bandit
text: Now that is a woman...

speaker: Manuela
text: Uh-oh. They've noticed me. Here they come!

speaker: Thief
text: Just when I decide to disguise myself as a mountain bandit and sneak in, we get attacked. Just my luck!

speaker: Bandit Leader
text: We are the Death God Gang! We're all unstoppable!

speaker: Manuela
text: Hey! You're not the Death Knight! What gives?

speaker: Bandit Leader
text: Death Knight? What nonsense are you talking now? Do we look like knights to you, lady?

speaker: Manuela
text: You're just lousy hill bandits. Well, I'll teach you to waste my time!

speaker: Hanneman
text: Why, there is no Death Knight here. That student's testimony was, well, it was utter bunk!

speaker: Bandit Leader
text: Hey, you! The weird old dude with the beard! What kinda crap are you mumbling to yourself there?

speaker: Hanneman
text: I beg your pardon?! Do not image you can insult me without some form of retribution!

speaker: Hanneman
text: Manuela, are you uninjured?

speaker: Manuela
text: A few scrapes and bruises. But, yes, I'm well enough.

speaker: Manuela
text: How could anyone think that was the Death Knight? It was obviously just an ordinary bandit. Oh well, I may not have found my revenge, but at least we got to retrieve stolen goods.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Manuela! You unthinking fool!

speaker: Manuela
text: Hanneman, I've heard enough already.

speaker: Hanneman
text: How bloody stupid are you?! If that were the real Death Knight, you'd have new--likely fatal--wounds to match your first! Do you know how much you worried all of us? You should be ashamed!

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh no...

speaker: Byleth
text: Relax. She's OK.

speaker: Hanneman
text: This is a matter of life and death! It should not and must not be taken lightly!

speaker: Byleth
text: Hanneman's right.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Exactly! You are supposed to set an example for our students. Yet you let emotion get the better of you?

speaker: Manuela
text: You're right... So there, I said that. It's true, but, ugh. I'm sorry. I'll apologize to everyone later.

speaker: Hanneman
text: I should say I'm sorry as well. I lost my temper just now. I see you act so irrationally, and I lose my wits. I care about you a great deal, and wish to see you safe. Will you believe me?

speaker: Manuela
text: Yes, of course. I'm the same way, after all. I let my emotions get the best of me. We're both too old to be shouting all the time.

speaker: Byleth
text: So, everyone is friends again?

speaker: Manuela
text: You're awfully quick to but a bow on this. Are you sick of us already, Professor?

speaker: Hanneman
text: You're part of this, Professor. We are the only teachers this academy has. No need for bickering!

speaker: Manuela
text: Well said, Hanneman. Would you care to join me for a celebratory drink?

speaker: Hanneman
text: That sounds lovely. Perhaps a nice cup of tea is in order.

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmmm... What was that name again?

speaker: Byleth
text: What's on your mind?

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh, this is frustrating me to no end! I simply can't recall. Oh, I have it! Zanado!

speaker: Byleth
text: Zanado, the Red Canyon?

speaker: Sothis
text: That's it! It was not long ago that we were there... And still, I somehow managed to forget!

speaker: Byleth
text: Where we defeated the thieves....

speaker: Sothis
text: That's it! It was not long ago that we were there... And still, I somehow managed to forget!

speaker: Byleth
text: What is that?

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh my, your memory is even worse than mine. It was not long ago that we were there!

speaker: Byleth
text: What about it?

speaker: Sothis
text: Well... That place brought back some fragments of my memory. I cannot help but wonder why. I feel we must return to find some answers there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Sothis
text: Yes, you are right! For as the saying goes, there is no time like the present.

speaker: Byleth
text: Now isn't the time.

speaker: Sothis
text: No? You must delight in spoiling my mood... Well, if you refuse to go, there's little I can do... Please tell me if you change your mind.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hmm... Our professor is sneaking off alone. Where to, I wonder...

speaker: Hubert
text: I don't recall hearing of any such plans for our class. Perhaps we should follow.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Intrigued, are we? Yes, let's do just that. We will consider it...extra training.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It is most unlike our professor to go wandering alone like that...

speaker: Dedue
text: Curious, Your Highness?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. I have an uneasy feeling about this. Let's gather the others and find out what is going on.

speaker: Hilda
text: Huh? Where's our professor going all alone like that?

speaker: Claude
text: I hate not knowing what's going on... OK, that's it. Let's gather the others and get to the bottom of this.

speaker: Hilda
text: You want to follow our teacher?! What a pain... Ugh, but I guess I'm dying of curiosity too.

speaker: Sothis
text: Yes... It is all coming back to me. This structure... Oh, but it's as though my memories are clouded. The most important pieces are obscured. But I once called this home. I have no doubt. I seem to recall something...on the other side of that wall. I cannot see it, but I can still feel it... It is not my imagination. I know this to be true. We are already deep within this valley...
Grrrraargh!

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh! What was that awful sound?!

speaker: Byleth
text: You heard something?

speaker: Sothis
text: This is not time to joke around! Do not pretend you didn't hear!

speaker: Byleth
text: It was a terrible scream.

speaker: Sothis
text: Yes. And that was not a normal beast, but a huge and terrifying one!

speaker: Sothis
text: Look! There! At the entrance of the valley...a giant shadow!

speaker: Sothis
text: What is it now?!

speaker: Sothis
text: Those hungry wolves... That howl must have riled them up. We have no choice but to fight our way out. Give it your all!

speaker: Hubert
text: It's good we've caught up with the professor, but this situation is--hard to put into words, actually.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Wolves to the front, hawks to the rear, and what appears to be a Demonic Beast at the canyon's mouth...

speaker: Hubert
text: A wild beast, at that. Or perhaps it's more fitting to call it a stray.

speaker: Edelgard
text: If we can't prevail over that Demonic Beast, we won't make it out of the Red Canyon alive.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The first thing we need to do is reunite with our professor. The wolves are closing in...

speaker: Edelgard
text: More hawks... This is bad. We'll be caught from both sides!

speaker: Edelgard
text: The hawks are still coming. Perhaps we should see to those before we deal with the beast.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This is bad... It's a good thing we managed to catch up with our professor.

speaker: Dedue
text: Wolves at the front. Hawks at the rear. And at the canyon mouth, a Demonic Beast.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Or perhaps to call it a stray beast would be most fitting... If we cannot take out the beast, I doubt we will ever see the monastery again.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We must help our professor, first and foremost. This is a tough situation for anyone.

speaker: Dimitri
text: They must hope to catch us from both sides.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Blast! More hawks! We should probably take those out before we approach that beast...

speaker: Claude
text: It was the right move for us to follow Teach. But however you look at it, we're in a tough spot now...

speaker: Hilda
text: Wolves, hawks...not to mention a Demonic Beast guarding the canyon's entrance! We should never have come here.

speaker: Claude
text: Don't say that! But what's a Demonic Beast doing here? Is it a stray? Even Teach would have trouble out here all alone. Let's help out before we're down one professor!

speaker: Claude
text: First thing's first. We need to reunite with Teach. Hurry up, everyone!

speaker: Claude
text: Great...more hawks. Those feathery jerks are trying to take us out from both sides!

speaker: Claude
text: More hawks?! The air's swarming with those feathered freaks! Let's get them before we fight the beast.

speaker: Wild Demonic Beast
text: Graaargh!

speaker: Sothis
text: This thing... It has no will or mind to call its own. You must now strike it down! That is the best you can hope to offer this poor, lost soul.

speaker: Claude
text: Do you think it was once a human, like Miklan? No... It's not possible...

speaker: Flayn
text: Let us put an end to its suffering. I think that is the most honorable thing we can do at this point.

speaker: Sothis
text: Our work is done? My, my... Things did not go as planned. Let us return, before any more hawks or wolves join us. But what was that Demonic Beast doing within the Red Canyon...

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm glad you are safe, Professor. It was rather reckless of you to venture out alone like that.

speaker: Hubert
text: I suppose we came out here without permission too. If we all wish to avoid punishment... Perhaps we can all agree that we came out here for an extra-curricular activity. Let's leave it at that.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Still, I would like to know what brought you to this valley in the first place...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor, I am so glad that you are unharmed. What if something had happened to you?

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness, our instructor is safe. We should return to the monastery at once.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, I suppose you are right. If we stay here much longer, we are sure to be reprimanded.

speaker: Dedue
text: It is not untrue to assert that our professor led us here for battle experience...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue, you surprise me! And you, Professor. I hope you will tell us what brought you here...

speaker: Claude
text: Listen, Teach. No one likes aimless wandering more than me, but it's not worth dying over.

speaker: Hilda
text: Well, we're all OK now, so let's just focus on the positive. Ooh, maybe we can tell folks back at the monastery that we came here for battle training? With our dear professor's permission?

speaker: Claude
text: Hilda, you scamp! No one has a knack for getting out of trouble quite like you do. It is a gift, milady.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, is that right? Well, no one can get into trouble quite like you, so it works out!

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh dear... I put us in a bit of danger there! We are most fortunate that those delinquents followed us... You very nearly met your end! What a marvelous professor you must be, for all your students to be so concerned.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm proud of us.

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmm, you seem more confident in your ability to teach. But that makes sense, as you have me to help you out.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not used to it yet.

speaker: Sothis
text: You are not used to it? Hm. You must start thinking of yourself as a professor here. Be confident, as you have me to help you out.

speaker: Sothis
text: How disappointing to have dived so deep into danger, and yet to have nothing to show. Huh? What is this...strange feeling... My memories... Do you feel them stirring? How curious. You seem to have grown stronger! And all thanks to our journey to Zanado. It really was worth all that effort!

speaker: Byleth
text: I found something...

speaker: Sothis
text: Huh? You found this? I daresay you may find a use for that. You should decide how best to use that thing. But wow! We got a lot out of this trip. It was a bother for a spell, but in the end, I feel we should think fondly of our little trip. We actually had a delightful time, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Claude
text: Hm...

speaker: Claude
text: Very interesting...

speaker: Byleth
text: What's interesting?

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you reading?

speaker: Claude
text: Oh, Teach! How long have you been there? Don't sneak up on me like that! You almost gave me a heart attack. Anyway, I'm reading the official biography of the Four Saints, as sanctioned by the church. I know you're not very familiar with the teachings of Seiros, but even you must have read it at least once.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe...

speaker: Claude
text: Huh. I'm amazed you managed to get a job teaching at an academy run by the church.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so...

speaker: Claude
text: Tell me again... How exactly did you manage to get a job teaching at an academy run by the church?

speaker: Claude
text: Well, whether you've read the biography or not, the Four Saints must at least ring a bell, right?

speaker: Claude
text: Well then, I've got a little quiz for you. Name the Four Saints, companions of the great Saint Seiros. I'll give you a hint. There was Cichol, Cethleann, Indech, and... who was the fourth one again?

speaker: Byleth
text: Macile.

speaker: Claude
text: Ooh, tough luck! That would be incorrect. The name you were looking for is Macuil.

speaker: Byleth
text: Macuil.

speaker: Claude
text: Correct! I was hoping you'd know that much at least.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maicul.

speaker: Claude
text: Ooh, tough luck! That would be incorrect. The name you were looking for is Macuil.

speaker: Claude
text: In any case, you can learn some interesting things reading about the life and times of Saint Macuil. For instance, he was more skilled with his hands than his fellow saints, and even became an accomplished blacksmith. He used his skills to forge countless sacred weapons for the army of Seiros. Of course, he didn't just forge weapons. He also used them in battle himself. Legends say his strength was second only to Seiros. It's even said that he played a big role in the Battle of Tailtean, where Seiros fought Nemesis, the King of Liberation who became the king of evil. Macuil lost his life in that battle, and now his body rests in a coffin within the Holy Mausoleum. Or so one story goes. Another legend says he set off on a journey to find a new land. That he left Fódlan from the east, crossed the sea, and vanished. He must have left Alliance territory, but where exactly would he have set sail from, I wonder? Thinking about it reminds me of another interesting story concerning the Sreng Region. The peninsula is attached to the mainland of Fódlan and extends from the northeastern part of Kingdom territory. If you would set sail from Margrave Edmund's territory, you could cut cross a stretch of sea and land there. And it just so happens that in the Sreng Region, there are ruins built to worship a sacred beast that appeared from across the sea. If the ruins have something to do with Saint Macuil, there could be sacred weapons there... So? Have I piqued your interest or what?

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe a little.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not really.

speaker: Claude
text: You always have to play it cool, don't you? Just think of how useful it would be to have weapons like that! Not to mention that the peninsula would be pretty easy to get to about now, seeing as how Alliance territory has settled down a bit. We'd be there and back in no time. No one would even notice we were gone. Come on, Teach! Let's go to the Sreng Region!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Claude
text: I always see it through once I set my mind on something. Let's make the necessary preparations before I die of curiosity.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let me think about it.

speaker: Claude
text: I guess I can wait...just a while. But make sure you decide before I die of curiosity, OK?

speaker: Claude
text: There are the ruins... It looks like we're not gonna have the luxury of an excavation. Look. I bet those are the watchmen of the ruins, and that they've been ordered to keep out intruders. And that big beast... I hear they call it The Wind Caller.

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: Thieves... Only by defeating me can you claim the secret treasure!

speaker: Claude
text: Argh! It speaks! What is it?!

speaker: Thief
text: Huh? Who are you? I'm just here for a bit of treasure! Don't attack me!

speaker: Claude
text: Someone got here first... Must be a band of looters. We can't let them get the treasure! Guess their luck's about to run out.

speaker: Thief
text: You're not trying to take this treasure from me, are you?

speaker: Thief
text: The treasure... I thought it would make me rich...

speaker: Thief
text: If I don't get this treasure back, the boss is gonna be really angry with me!

speaker: Thief
text: I should never have become a thief...

speaker: Thief
text: After all the trouble we went through to get this treasure, I'm not gonna let you get your hands on it!

speaker: Thief
text: Gah... Those thieves...

speaker: Thief Leader
text: Huh? Are you looting too? Well, I'm not letting you have this treasure!

speaker: Thief Leader
text: No! That's my treasure...

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: You have had your fun. If you are going to flee, now is your chance. If you are not going to flee... I shall take your life as payment!

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: Hmmm... Those who stand before me... How long has it been? Hundreds of years? Thousands? You have the stink of Sothis upon you... Let us find out whether you share her power.

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: I smell those detestable 10 Elites... Who are you?

speaker: Claude
text: I'm the grandson of the grandson of the grandson of the elite Riegan. Now tell me who you are!

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: I am your family's enemy. If you carry the blood of the 10 Elites, you cannot be permitted to live.

speaker: Claude
text: What do you mean by that? And what's that Crest on your forehead?

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: No more talk. If you wish to survive, you must destroy me!

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: Ah, that face takes me back in time... You have not changed one bit, Ceth-

speaker: Flayn
text: I ask that you keep quiet, Uncle!

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: Why the rush, Ceth-

speaker: Flayn
text: Shh! Please keep quiet, Uncle!

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: Are these your companions?

speaker: Seteth
text: They are indeed. I should tell you that Seiros is in a precarious state right now.

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: I will not assist you. I have lived apart from the world of man, which disgusts me so. This war disgusts me also.

speaker: Seteth
text: I thought you might say as much. This is regrettable.

speaker: Claude
text: It stopped moving... It is dead?

speaker: The Wind Caller
text: Zzz...

speaker: Claude
text: No... It seems it's just sleeping... I thought we were supposed to be given the treasure, but... Forget it. I'll just have a look around there. What about this thing? Huh. I'll think about it later.

speaker: Claude
