text: Thanks for all your hard work, Teach. Sorry for dragging you along with me. I had no idea it would turn into a fight. But hey, at least we got some treasure out of it. I'll leave this in your capable hands. Do with it as you will.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Claude
text: You know our friends even better than I do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why don't we share it?

speaker: Claude
text: How would we do that?

speaker: Claude
text: Give it to whoever you think it'll suit best. More importantly, I didn't go there looking for treasure. Not really. Legends about the saints abound. It's hard to tell fact from fiction. I like to confirm whatever I can, with my own eyes, to find the truth in those legends.

speaker: Byleth
text: What did you find out?

speaker: Claude
text: Not a thing. We didn't find anything concrete to prove that Saint Macuil had been there. We can't say for certain that the treasure we found was Macuil's either. I do wish we could have spoken to that Wind Caller a bit more.

speaker: Byleth
text: Could it have been Saint Macuil?

speaker: Claude
text: Ha! Unlikely. Macuil lived thousands of years ago. And I've never heard anything about the saints being monsters like that. Wait a minute... Could the Wind Caller have anything to do with the Immaculate One? The Immaculate One is a monster sent by the goddess... Could the Wind Caller be... Where was it that I heard that stuff about them having been sent by the goddess... Ugh, maybe I'm too tired. My head is heavy and I can't think straight anymore. Let's call it a day for now. I've got plenty of time to think this over.

speaker: Hubert
text: Professor. You're here.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you send for me?

speaker: Hubert
text: No. But while you are here, you may as well listen. I am sure you recall hearing about Kronya, Solon, and Lord Arundel. I am investigating their true identities. I want to know their origins. Their numbers. Their base of operations. Their plans. I want to know where they acquired their dark powers. How they disguise themselves. Many intriguing mysteries surround these people. Wouldn't you agree?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Hubert
text: I have a name for them.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not really.

speaker: Hubert
text: No? I suppose someone of your statue has more immediately pressing concerns. Well, I have a name for them.

speaker: Hubert
text: Those who slither in the dark...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Lord Hubert! Pardon me, but Lord Arundel is at the monastery. He says he wants to discuss something with you and is waiting in the reception hall.

speaker: Hubert
text: Speaking of... Professor, would you come along?

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Hubert. I have something I must request of you.

speaker: Hubert
text: Request? That is an unusual word choice. A request, by definition, can be refused. But if you have orders, Regent, I will follow them.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Heh. Such a reaction before you even hear me out. Very well. One of my subordinates was conducting experiments in the Sealed Forest. The Demonic Beast he was using ran wild and has created something of a...situation. Take care of it.

speaker: Hubert
text: Experiments, you say? Heh...very well. I will set out at once.  Professor, will you assist?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Hubert
text: Thank you for your support. It is a great help.

speaker: Byleth
text: Now is not a good time.

speaker: Hubert
text: I understand. I will call upon those who are able to move immediately. Let me know if you change your mind. It will take some time to prepare.

speaker: Hubert
text: My, my. Looks like this forest became infested with Demonic Beasts while we weren't looking. I suppose we've not a moment to lose. Not that I'm concerned for any of these...people. But since there may be a reward in it for us, we may as well do what we can to rescue them.

speaker: Hubert
text: Now then. Let's split up and move in to assist. It may be worth focusing your attention on those being targeted by multiple Demonic Beasts.

speaker: Mysterious Mage 1
text: What a disgrace to be saved by those fools...

speaker: Mysterious Mage 2
text: Enough. These certainly proved useful. Go ahead and take them.

speaker: Hubert
text: Your tools, I gather? Yes, I suppose we will take them off your hands since you asked so nicely.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: I'm surprised at you, Hubert. Saving all of my poor subordinates...

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Hmph. Casualties. You were not as helpful as I had thought you would be.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Byleth
text: We did the best we could.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: I am not criticizing you. This failure is my own for thinking you were capable of more.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: It seems gratitude is in order. Let us meet again soon.

speaker: Hubert
text: Good riddance. What a nuisance that man is. He and his ilk must be aware of my investigation. No doubt this was all an attempt to make us believe we are powerless against them. It has only achieved the opposite effect.

speaker: Byleth
text: How so?

speaker: Hubert
text: They are looking down on us. They think we cannot touch them. But the closer we get to them, the less true that becomes. Just look at this weaponry we received as a token of their appreciation. It would be impossible for us to manufacture such a piece with our current tools and knowledge. It is not as powerful as a Relic, but it is nearly so. We will keep them close, for now, while we still need their strength to rule Fódlan. Once Fódlan is united, however, the focus of this war will shift. Rather than swords clashing on the battlefield, it will be knives cutting in the darkness. Lady Edelgard's war will be over, and House Vestra's will begin. We who rule the shadows will eradicate those who slither in the dark. When that time comes, Professor, you will be quite useful to us.

speaker: Duke Aegir
text: Can't...stop...running...

speaker: Duke Aegir
text: Wha--?!

speaker: Rogue A
text: We got you! You're the prime minister, aren't you?

speaker: Rogue B
text: Not anymore. He lost his power and his fancy title. Now he's just a man.

speaker: Rogue C
text: Shut up!

speaker: Rogue A
text: Yeah! Do you know what you've done to regular folks like us? Since you villains took over the Hrym territory, our lives have been nothing but pain and misery! Heavy taxes, forced labor. It's brutal!

speaker: Rogue D
text: Now we're gonna make you pay!

speaker: Duke Aegir
text: Agh! Argh! Aaaaaaaargh!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Hm, such a nice selection of tea leaves in the pantry here.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Tea is nice and all, but it's not much good when you don't have sweets to go with it.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Sweet treats are less common, yes, but perhaps that makes sense. War is not sugar-coated.

speaker: Lysithea
text: If you've got time to be cheeky, you've got time to find me some sweets.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: But Lysithea, your smile is so sweet--

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Lord Ferdinand! Excuse the interruption. Our scouts happened upon the information you were looking for. I thought it would be best to let you know as soon as possible.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: They know where my father is?!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Tell me, now.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: After losing his position as prime minister, your father was held in Enbarr for a very long time. He escaped. For a while, no one knew where he was. The other day, however, he was sighted alone in the Hrym territory. Seemed he was heading for an allied region.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Hrym...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Alone, you say. Was he safe?

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I'm afraid not... There is a major insurrection happening in the Hrym territory. It's been five years since Duke Aegir lost his control of the area... The military seems to have finally lost control, and the people's violence is unleashed.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I do not understand. Why are they rioting?

speaker: Lysithea
text: It's obvious, isn't it? Ferdinand, do you really know nothing about Hrym? Your own father was ruling it -- you don't know what became of the area once he fell from power?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: If it was truly a House Aegir territory, I would have been trained in governing the area. But my father insisted that I have nothing to do with Hrym. But now is not the time to talk about this. We have to help him before he gets caught up in the violence.

speaker: Lysithea
text: You're right. Now isn't the time for chitchat. Let's get over there quickly. Professor, will you be coming?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll go with you.

speaker: Lysithea
text: We'd better depart as soon as possible. I know a bit about the situation. I'll fill you in later.

speaker: Byleth
text: I want you to wait.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I understand. If you cannot help us, the Knights of Seiros will, so it is not a problem.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Professor, time is of the essence. If you're going to come with us, prepare as quickly as you can.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: This is where my father was sighted? The citizens are rioting everywhere.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Over there! Quick -- we need to help them!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: There seem to be some people inciting the violence. If we take them out, perhaps the violence will subside.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It might be best to spread out...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The north side of the town is in chaos. I do not think we can advance.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It seems better to simply hold the line against the enemies to the north, and focus our efforts on saving the citizens in the east and south.

speaker: Villager
text: Th-thank you! Looks like I won't be robbed this time!

speaker: Villager
text: Thank you ever so much for helping us! I don't know what would have happened if it weren't for you...

speaker: Villager
text: We owe you our lives! We're saved! Saved, I say!

speaker: Villager
text: I get to live another day, and it's all because you came to the rescue!

speaker: Lysithea
text: I think that's all of them. I'm so glad we were able to help everyone.

speaker: Rogue
text: All right! Let's ransack this place!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ugh, we weren't fast enough! But there's still time to save the others. Hurry!

speaker: Rogue
text: Oh yeah, keep going! Hahaha!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: They got past us...again. We have to save the next one!

speaker: Rogue
text: I'll take whatever I want, and there ain't nothing you can do to stop me!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ugh, they ransacked another house! But there may be others yet who need our help.

speaker: Rogue
text: All right, boys! Smash and grab whatever's left!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: We could not save anyone?! It infuriates me to feel so helpless...

speaker: Rogue
text: Oh, looky there, some houses are still untouched! Let's give 'em a good plundering, boys!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Professor, let's make haste and go help them! Their lives may be forfeit if we don't get to them quickly.

speaker: Rogue Grappler
text: Hyaah! Go on, boys! Riot to your heart's content!

speaker: Rogue Grappler
text: Argh! I'm not the only...bad guy here...

speaker: Rogue Thief
text: What?! W-we give up! Have mercy! That guy made us do it!

speaker: Rogue Swordmaster
text: Hahaha! If we cause enough chaos, we can do whatever we want!

speaker: Rogue Swordmaster
text: My ambition...unfulfilled...

speaker: Rogue Thief
text: We yield! Yield! We were just following orders! It's not like we love a good riot, really!

speaker: Rogue Sniper
text: What do you want?! You'd better not stand in our way!

speaker: Rogue Sniper
text: And after I went to all the trouble of killing that noble and stealing his treasure...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Father, no! So, we were too late after all...

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ferdinand... Hey.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Yes?

speaker: Lysithea
text: I... I don't know what to say. About your father, I mean.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: No, it is all right. Some part of me was expecting this. I do not know what happened in Hrym territory, but I'm sure he got what he deserved. You knew more about it, you said? Maybe you can tell me everything later.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I can tell you what I know.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Please do.

speaker: Lysithea
text: You know about the Hrym rebellion, right?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Of course. The rebellion started when Emperor Ionius IX tried to consolidate power. The Hrym family tried to split off from the Empire and join the Alliance. Working with House Ordelia, they raised an insurrection. The Empire suppressed it. And then a puppet leader was installed in the Hrym territory. House Aegir was tasked with handling the actual governance of the region. Seeing this, the nobles feared that the Empire would assume total control. That's when the six great noble families chose to wrest power from Ionius IX.

speaker: Lysithea
text: That's right. The Insurrection of the Seven. I've always wondered why it was called seven when there were only six noble families.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: It was the six great noble families, plus Hrym.

speaker: Lysithea
text: How vexing. Either way, events unfolded shortly thereafter. Are you aware of how Duke Aegir was ruling the Hrym territory? He imposed harsh taxes upon the people -- much harsher than on his own -- making their lives very challenging. People fled their homes in droves to the neighboring Ordelia territory. But they were sent back from where they came. The Empire was occupying Ordelia territory as well, as it turned out. Issues were further complicated when Duke Aegir fell from power. Aegir was dismissed from his position, only to be replaced by Lord Arundel.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Edelgard's uncle, the regent of the Empire...

speaker: Lysithea
text: Correct. And he imposed even heavier taxes on the people, squeezing them painfully dry. The people were conscripted for duty. Any who opposed were killed on the spot. Lord Arundel did this in the name of Duke Aegir.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: What?!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Your father was by no means a great ruler. But it was Lord Arundel who stoked the fury of the people and directed that fury at your father. Duke Aegir is not perfect, but he's not the villain in this.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Lysithea, thank you for telling me all this. I am embarrassed to say, I had no idea. I see now that it was not his fault. But he did go along the wrong path, and place a burden on his people. He can no longer atone for what he did, so I will have to. I need to go think about what I will do after the war. How I will make up for my father's mistakes.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Nothing helps deep thought like sweets.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Hm?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Sweets. They help you think. Perhaps you should find some for us.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I see. If I find some, I will be sure to let you know.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, Professor. You're looking lovely as ever.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Are you working today? You gotta take a day sometime. Get out in the world and have some fun.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not a bad idea.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Right? Sometimes you gotta forget all the things you oughta do and focus on what you'd rather do. Hey, we should go get something to eat. My treat.

speaker: Byleth
text: I could never...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Aw, come on, Professor. Let me buy you something to eat. Relax for a couple hours at least.

speaker: Byleth
text: No, thank you.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ah, fine. You're missing out though.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you after?

speaker: Sylvain
text: What? I can't invite my professor to dinner without it being a scam? Heh! I...ah...OK, fine. You got me.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I need to ask a favor, and I wanted a way to work up the courage to ask you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Ask me what?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is this about a girl?

speaker: Sylvain
text: No, for once it's not about a girl.

speaker: Sylvain
text: There are thieves in my father's territory. I was wondering if you'd go with me to drive 'em off. You remember the thief leader you fought at Conand Tower, yeah?

speaker: Byleth
text: Your brother?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yes, Miklan. He was the oldest son of House Gautier.

speaker: Byleth
text: Miklan?

speaker: Sylvain
text: That's right. Although he's dead now...

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes, that's crazy.

speaker: Sylvain
text: The way my father is...he probably has some other motive that I'll never know.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why just you?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Because he thinks he'd lose face asking the church for help. I don't know. He could have asked another trusted house to send troops, but he only asked me. And the way my father is...he probably has some other motive that I'll never know.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Maybe he just wants me to get some more experience in battle. Crazy way to suggest it though. Anyway, I'm not going alone, no matter what he asks. I'm going to ask some of the others in our class to help too. But none of us have your expertise. If you'd come with us, I'd be grateful.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Great! I'll talk to the others and see who's in. Thanks, Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't right now.

speaker: Sylvain
text: OK. I understand. I did kind of just drop that question on you, huh? If you change your mind though, let me know. I'll be around for a bit.

speaker: Sylvain
text: OK, we've got the thieves covered on both sides. Some of the thieves are still carrying what they stole, so we have a chance to get it back. Gotta be careful, though. They'll run off faster than a nobleman's daughter if we just rush in. Target the strongholds to cut off their escape routes.

speaker: Sylvain
text: My father's offering a reward for every thief and rogue we take out. The more you beat, the more you get. Just remember, you gotta take them down fast. They'll bolt as soon as they're hurt. Take the strongholds and we cut off their escape route.

speaker: Sylvain
text: OK, that'll do it. This exit route is blocked off. Very good. Now, let's keep cool and take out the other strongholds.

speaker: Sylvain
text: That's one more stronghold taken and one more escape route blocked. There are still some strongholds left. Professor, which should we go for first?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Another escape route blocked. We're nearly done! Take out those thieves, and capture that last stronghold.

speaker: Thief
text: We've been rattled... Let's get out of here for now.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ugh, they're getting away! If only we'd taken the stronghold out in time.

speaker: Thief
text: I guess we've pinched enough stuff here. That'll keep our bellies stuffed for a while!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor, are you letting them get away? Come on, we gotta block off their escape routes!

speaker: Thief Leader
text: Gah... I'm not sticking round here to get slaughtered by a bunch of stuck up jerks like you!

speaker: Thief Leader
text: Hey, I know that face. You're the boss's little bro, right?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I'm sorry to say it, but yeah, I'm his brother. And he's led you into a bad spot. Anyway, your boss is dead. So this is your chance to disband this little thief gang of yours.

speaker: Thief Leader
text: Quiet, fool! You think I have any other choice but to be a thief?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Well, it's probably on me for making such a stupid request.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor, thank you for your help. We drove off the thieves and got a reward from my father. Job well done, eh? Although, I don't know how to feel about this particular reward.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I guess that's why my father tasked me with this particular mission. He wanted me to prove myself worthy of this Relic. This weapon, the Lance of Ruin... It killed my brother, and now it's mine.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't that dangerous?

speaker: Syvlain
text: Not remotely. I bear the Crest of Gautier. The same Crest my brother wished for his whole life but never came to possess.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're still thinking about your brother, aren't you?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I suppose I am... Miklan hated me from the moment he found out I had a Crest and he didn't. He was selfish and egotistical. I know it's not right to say bad things about the dead, but he earned it. Even now, I'm still cleaning up his messes. I have to wonder though... What if it was the other way around? If he had the Crest and I didn't... Would I be the one my father thought was worth forgetting? Or would my fate have been wholly unlike his?

speaker: Byleth
text: Thinking like that won't get you anywhere.

speaker: Sylvain
text: You're probably right, Professor. It's not like me, is it? I don't pray much...but I think I'm going to pray for those who lost their lives to the thieves tonight. And for all of us. I'm afraid there are more days like this coming our way.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why do you say that?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Faerghus has always been a cold place. Never very well-to-do. Until about 10 years ago, our region was a battlefield for the people of the Sreng Region to the north. And after the late king fell, the whole Kingdom became unstable. So it's no real surprise that more and more people are resorting to thievery just to survive. And there are those rumors of the current regent being too busy chasing the ladies to bother with governing. Don't worry, I get the irony. The whole damn Kingdom is in decline because of nonsense like that. I'm hoping once we get Dimitri on the throne everything will get better. Anyway, I'll leave it up to you to decide how you want to use our reward. Including the Lance of Ruin. I know I can trust you with it until you think I'm ready. And, Professor, if I could, I'd still like to buy you a meal sometime.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's no need.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Or do you really just hate the idea of having dinner with me? Just kidding! I know you're busy.

speaker: Byleth
text: You have another favor to ask?

speaker: Sylvain
text: No, I'm just asking a friend to hang out, that's all.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Again though, thank you for everything, Professor. I couldn't have done it alone.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There... We must rethink the supply route now that the battle lines have moved. This one will be Hubert...and Count Bergliez will oversee this force here...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ah, Professor... Is something wrong? Sorry, I thought I had a bit more time before the council meeting.

speaker: Byleth
text: You never stop working.

speaker: Edelgard
text: True. Though ideally, I'd like to hand off anything I can to my subordinates. But while we're on the front lines, I can't help but worry about every little thing.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sorry to bother you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: No bother at all, but I'm afraid I'm not quite finished here. Still, I'm happy to see you. Your presence lightens my mood a great deal.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Now, let's see...

speaker: Hubert
text: Pardon, Your Majesty. An urgent matter.

speaker: Edelgard
text: What's happened?

speaker: Hubert
text: There is an army from Almyra at Fódlan's Throat. Reports indicate it is of appreciable size.

speaker: Byleth
text: Fódlan's Throat?

speaker: Hubert
text: A steep mountain range runs along the border between Fódlan and Almyra. That mountain range is called Fódlan's Throat. The sturdy fortress built within those mountains is called Fódlan's Locket. It occupies the sole path through. The church and the Alliance nobles built the Locket to safeguard against Almyran invasion.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Normally, House Goneril watches over the fortress. In times of trouble, the lords join together to protect it. But I assume it would be too difficult to defend against this incursion with only the troops of Goneril...

speaker: Hubert
text: The situation has been precarious for House Goneril since Holst fell ill.

speaker: Byleth
text: Holst?

speaker: Hubert
text: The heir to House Goneril, renowned for his bravery. He is Hilda's elder brother.

speaker: Byleth
text: I see.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Holst is a formidable commander. it is only logical that House Goneril would struggle in his absence. The Alliance has shattered. They can't request soldiers from the surrounding lords. And the Imperial troops stationed there can't be relocated so easily. The best course of action is for us to go out there and deal with this ourselves. It's critical for us to protect that location. This is our chance to prove that we won't allow it to fall.

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes. It is to the benefit of our future governance not to abandon it. It seems this must be done. Will you assist us?

speaker: Byleth
text: I will.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We'll depart after you finish making preparations. Move swiftly. We must move before the Almyran army crosses the Throat.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let me think.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes... Preparations must still be made. We'll wait a bit longer. If you're not going to join us, we'll take those who are able and willing. Don't worry about it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It seems we made it in time. Let's help the soldiers of House Goneril withdraw. The Black Eagle Strike Force will protect Fódlan's Locket!

speaker: Goneril Soldier
text: Support! We're saved!

speaker: Nader
text: Reinforcements? And that flag belongs to the Imperial army... Ha! A fine enemy, indeed! Break through the Locket and make a name for yourself! No need to by shy--strike all at once!

speaker: Edelgard
text: We fight to protect Fódlan! If the defensive line is broken, we fail! Our enemies are many...but we can use the terrain to our advantage and stop them where they stand!

speaker: Nader
text: I must commend you for your courage, seeing as how you dare stand against me!

speaker: Nader
text: Your sword is fit to cleave a mountain in two. Care to try it out against the undefeated Nader?

speaker: Edelgard
text: They call you undefeated... Oh, but you've already suffered one defeat, have you not? And on this day, victory will again be ours!

speaker: Nader
text: The Once Defeated isn't quite as exciting, is it? I'll just have to claim this victory here to wipe away the shame of defeat!

speaker: Nader
text: So this is how far I go... Unbelievable... What a scary woman...

speaker: Edelgard
text: No matter how many times you attack, we will never allow you to capture the Throat.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The Almyran troops are difficult opponents... For now, I would much rather focus on Fódlan's internal territories. I hope they don't mount another attack anytime soon.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The Almyran Army retreated. Their casualties were numerous. As I understand it, they won't be attempting another invasion anytime soon. Still, we must prepare the local troops before their enemy returns.

speaker: Byleth
text: They are an irritating neighbor.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Indeed. But if possible, I would like to foster amicable relations with them.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe we can befriend them?

speaker: Edelgard
text: That is my hope. I would even consider a treaty.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Unlike Fódlan, Almyra is not a land ruled by a blind fealty to the goddess. I believe we need only to communicate openly with them and respect the differences between our cultures. If we do that, we should be able to have an meaningful dialogue with them, one more promising than what we can expect from followers of the goddess.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ah, Hubert. What did Duke Goneril say?

speaker: Hubert
text: He expresses his sincere gratitude to Lady Edelgard. In addition, he would like to leave the protection of the Throat to Imperial troops from now on.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Is that so? How reasonable of him. By the way, what was it that ailed Holst?

speaker: Hubert
text: I did not hear all the details, but apparently he ate some bad mushrooms. It is said he is now emaciated and pale, and his skin exudes a mysterious vapor.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Huh, I can't help but imagine what that must look like...but it's probably better not to think about it.

speaker: Hubert
text: Agreed. Do not worry yourself with such thoughts.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm too curious.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Indeed... Well, then maybe you should pay a visit. And then...you could tell me what it looked like.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's best left unseen.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's only one option, then. I must pay a visit on my own and see this ailment with my own eyes.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Actually... On second thought, I'd better not. As emperor, I can't risk it.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah, nothing like a moment of perfect stillness...

speaker: Petra
text: Why is it preferable to have stillness?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah! Petra? Please don't sneak up on me like that! Oh... You're here too, Professor? What's going on?

speaker: Petra
text: I was asking my question first. What are you enjoying about air that is still?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Um. Still air makes me feel better, that's all. It means you're in a nice, closed-off space where you can hide.

speaker: Petra
text: But spaces that are wide and open are wonderful. Places like forests and oceans.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Guess we'll have to agree to disagree about that.

speaker: Petra
text: I am not understanding your answer, but I am appreciating your explanation. I am reminded. I was wanting to ask if you wish to go to the forest or ocean with me?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Um. What? What part of anything I said would make you think I wanted that?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: So your grandfather is in trouble. He's trying to lend us soldiers from Brigid, but... Edelgard is sending messengers there to convince Brigid she's not their enemy.

speaker: Petra
text: You are saying messengers, but the truth is they are a threat. Brigid is having no power to refuse.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I get it, but what does this have to do with me?

speaker: Petra
text: Professor was asking this of me. I was told...if I am going to a far away place, to be taking Bernie with me, since she is hiding away.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: What?! Professor! What did I do to deserve this?! I know I'm a recluse, but I do go out on missions once in a while!

speaker: Byleth
text: You can't refuse.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Tyranny! Abuse of power! I have rights!

speaker: Byleth
text: Lend me your strength.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: You say that, but I don't think I'm ready for this.

It was, after all, founded with the goal of freedom from Faerghus. We prize that independence highly, even if it occasionally hinders cooperation. There is often talk of mutual aid, but the truth is that each noble acts to maximize personal benefit. At the moment, the Riegan Dukedom is in no state to keep those conflicting motivations in check. Alas, I must be off.

speaker: Byleth
text: Good luck.

speaker: Byleth

speaker: Lorenz

speaker: Lorenz

speaker: Lorenz
text: It is important to me that those I deal with understand its workings. What say you to broadening your horizons?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Indeed. This is the magic lance, Lúin, which has been passed down for generations within my family. My father and siblings have no way of using it, since they bear no Crest. Father told me I should take it and use it to protect myself with. He said it's far better used protecting his daughter than gathering dust.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Aw, that's so sweet! Your father really does mean well, Ingrid.

speaker: Ingrid
text: He's unendingly stubborn, but I am proud of who he is. Dorothea, Professor... I want to thank you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Dorothea
text: We couldn't just do nothing while you were facing a life of being married to a monster.

speaker: Byleth
text: It was important that we help you.

speaker: Dorothea
text: It really was quite exciting too! So, you know, don't worry about it.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I could never hand over my lovely Ingrid to some jerk who only wants her for her Crest.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Oh? Do I belong to you now, rather than to myself? Hey... Dorothea. This is probably more than a little awkward, considering where it came from, but...here.

speaker: Dorothea
text: A ring? Is this... No! Is it?!

speaker: Byleth
text: A proposal?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Oh, Ingrid... I accept your offer! We'll be together forever!

speaker: Byleth
text: A bribe?

speaker: Dorothea
text: I mean, sure, I suppose... Clumsy bribe though, giving me a ring and not telling me why.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Stop teasing me, Dorothea! I'm trying to be sincere. I wanted to find a way to emphasize how grateful I am to you. So I looked for something from among my things that I thought you would like. I mean...you may already have one like it, but I thought on the off chance you didn't...

speaker: Dorothea
text: Ingrid, you are just adorable and I love it. But perhaps we should lend this ring to our teacher for now. Our dear teacher can best decide how to use it. You found hard enough. You've earned the right to have a little fun.

speaker: Ingrid
text: As you wish, Dorothea. I gave the ring to you, so you can do whatever you please with it.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Haha.

speaker: Felix
text: There you are. I was looking for you. I need a favor.

speaker: Byleth
text: It’s unusual for you to ask for help.

speaker: Felix
text: Yes. It’s an unusual favor.

speaker: Byleth
text: You want to spar, right?

speaker: Felix
text: No. This is more serious.

speaker: Felix
text: My father sent a messenger. He wants me to return to Fraldarius territory.

speaker: Byleth
text: Your father?

speaker: Felix
text: Rodrigue Achille Fraldarius, the highest ranking member of the Faerghus nobility. I believe you've met him. So I heard. But about the favor. You’re familiar with the Tragedy of Duscur, I presume?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can’t recall.

speaker: Felix
text: Warriors from Duscur killed King Lambert of Faerghus.

speaker: Felix
text: After the king’s death, public order disintegrated. Bandits continue to raid villages across the Kingdom, including those within Fraldarius territory. My father says he needs my help driving the bandits away.

speaker: Byleth
text: And you want me to join you?

speaker: Felix
text: Precisely. Good guess. Perhaps I shouldn’t pull you into this... It stems from my family’s failure to secure the region. But honestly, I want to see you in action. I never tire of watching you fight. And it’ll be much more interesting for you than the training ground. Or maybe this task -- driving off bandits -- seems dull to a former mercenary?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll join you.

speaker: Felix
text: Excellent! While I’m at it, I have a second favor to ask of you. Could you recruit more fighters? I bet there will be willing volunteers, if you’re the one inviting them. I’ll set off on my own and meet up with you there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let me think about it.

speaker: Felix
text: OK. I can handle a few bandits. If you change your mind about it, tell me soon.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. Struggling to defeat some bandits? What a pathetic old man my father is. Some villagers are trapped. Let’s help them escape.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Felix, my son. You’ve finally brought reinforcements!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Everything will be fine! Good people of this hamlet, escape while you can!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The stronghold is ours. No more bandits should come crawling out of here.

speaker: Felix
text: Weakling. That should put a stop to their reinforcements.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: So it's you! From the Officers Academy. Thank you for taking such good care of my son. It pains me to trouble you, but I humbly request your assistance in helping secure the villagers' safe escape!

speaker: Felix
text: Pathetic. Struggling to defeat some ragtag bandits.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Felix... You may know this already, but no matter how many you kill, more always appear. Anywhere in the Kingdom these days you can see the same kind of scenes. His Majesty, the late king, would despair to see it.

speaker: Felix
text: A dead man doesn’t despair. Besides, let’s focus on the living.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Oh, Prince Dimitri is here to help! I am humbled, Your Highness, and so sorry to trouble you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: No, it is fine. As a man of royal birth, this is the obvious course. However, it does not exactly seem like they are remnants of Miklan's faction.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Indeed. Nothing but common bandits, and yet... Ruffians like that have recently surged in number.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am aware. For now, let us focus on saving the villagers.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Outmatched by a damn bandit...

speaker: Felix
text: Come now. Stop living in denial, old man.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I cannot die in this place... His Majesty would want me to keep going...

speaker: Felix
text: My foolish father... He's in trouble.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Everyone, I'm sorry. It's over for me...

speaker: Villager
text: Thank you so much! Please, help my neighbors too.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: That should do it. We’ve chased those ruffians away for good.

speaker: Villager
text: Thank you so much for your assistance! Please accept this small gift as thanks.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: We are grateful for your help. I doubt those bandits will stop anytime soon. But at least this village is safe. This village was important to the late king. If we hadn’t saved it, I wouldn’t have been able to face His Majesty.

speaker: Felix
text: How foolish.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Pardon?

speaker: Felix
text: We were protecting your subjects, not your ego. I don’t give a damn as to whether you can bring yourself to face a dead king.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I will not tolerate such language from you.

speaker: Felix
text: I came here to hone my blade, and to save innocent people. I suppose if I had died, you would say the same thing you did after Glenn’s death. “He died like a true knight.”

speaker: Felix
text: I have nothing more to say. I’m going back.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm sorry you had to see that. He's been that way for four years now. Of course, I understand his sentiment, to some extent. It all comes down to... Well, a difference of opinion.

speaker: Seteth
text: Here you are. There is something we need to discuss. I found this letter in Rhea's quarters. I believe it is intended for you.

speaker: Byleth
text: How do you know that?

speaker: Seteth
text: Simple. Your name appears at the top. Once I saw that, I decided not to read any further. I will admit, however, that I am quite curious. Will you permit me to read it along with you?

speaker: Rhea
text: Dear child... I have little time, and so I will keep this brief. I asked you to take care of things should something happen, but I wished to make myself useful as well. I left a treasure at the Holy Tomb. Please take it. However, note that I set a bit of a trap to prevent thieves from stealing it. Please take ample precautions so that you are not harmed when you retrieve it. May Sothis protect you... -Rhea

speaker: Seteth
text: Judging by the rushed handwriting, she must have written this just prior to the battle five years ago. I know nothing of this treasure, but it must be quite valuable. If you intend to recover it, then I will accompany you. Shall we go?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Seteth
text: The letter does indicate that Rhea laid some sort of trap in the Holy Tomb. We should bring some allies along, just to be safe.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not now.

speaker: Seteth
text: This was clearly important to Rhea. It certainly warrants a closer look in my opinion. Let me know if you change your mind.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Professor. So this is where you were. I have something I would like to show you.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I found this in Lady Rhea's room. It seems to be a letter...addressed to you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you enter the room on your own?

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you check out the room on your own?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I admit some guilt to the action. However, I hoped Lady Rhea had left something behind. I have not read the contents of the letter. If you do not object, could we read it together?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Her handwriting is a mess. It is likely she wrote this letter five years ago, just before the battle. If Lady Rhea says it's a treasure, then I've no doubt it would be useful to us. If you plan to retrieve it, I will accompany you. What is your plan, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Gilbert
text: However, it says Lady Rhea laid some manner of trap in the Holy Tomb. Just to be safe, I'd like to request somebody to accompany us. We don't know what dangers await.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not now.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I defer to your judgment, Professor. But are you sure? Please let me know if you change your mind.

speaker: Claude
text: Here you are, Teach. Take a look at this.

speaker: Claude
text: I found it in Rhea's room. It's addressed to you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you enter her room on your own?

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you look through her room on your own?

speaker: Claude
text: Well, I know it's not necessarily fair to Rhea, but there's no way I wasn't going to take a look. I thought I might find some valuable information. Or even some treasures that could be useful for the coming war! In the end...all I found was that letter. I obviously couldn't read it before you did. Go ahead. I'm sick with curiosity.

speaker: Claude
text: Her handwriting is messy. She must have written it right before that battle five years ago. That treasure... If it belongs to Rhea, there's no doubt that it has great value. It would be bad if some thief managed to sneak off with it. Let's go and get it, Teach!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Claude
text: Great! But...there's a trap there that might injure us? Huh. Just to be safe, there's a friend I'd like to invite as well. After all, who knows what lies ahead.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not now.

speaker: Claude
text: Wow. Even though Rhea left that special treasure behind just for you... Let me know if you change your mind, OK? I'll be around.

speaker: Seteth
text: These are the guardians of the Holy Tomb. They will attack any intruders. We had better take care.

speaker: Seteth
text: Rather excessive merely to deter thieves, isn't it? We should target those commanding phantoms.

speaker: Seteth
text: These phantoms are strengthening the golems. We must defeat the phantoms first.

speaker: Seteth
text: That's one, but there are others. We need to handle all of these commanders.

speaker: Seteth
text: That's reduced the golems' strength. Now's our chance to take them out.

speaker: Seteth
text: We have subdued the Holy Tomb's guardians. Let us get what Rhea left behind so we can leave this place.

speaker: Seteth
text: Got it! Ah--this seems important.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Something is wrong. Do not let your guard down.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Phantoms? And some are giving commands. Remove them from the battlefield immediately.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Mechanical beasts... Locate their puppet masters, and eliminate them!

speaker: Gilbert
text: One down! Target the remaining commanders!

speaker: Gilbert
text: The puppets still move, but they appear weaker. Destroying them should be easier now.

speaker: Gilbert
text: It seems all is safe. Let's find Lady Rhea's treasure, quickly.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Here! So this is Lady Rhea's treasure...

speaker: Claude
text: There's something there. Are those the devices that Rhea warned us about?

speaker: Claude
text: Those are the phantoms... And some of them are giving orders. Let's target those first.

speaker: Claude
text: Giant monsters... It would be best to take care of whoever's controlling them straight away.

speaker: Claude
text: They may be phantoms, but they can still be harmed. Let's take out the other commanders!

speaker: Claude
text: Those giant monsters can still move, but they seem much weaker now. We should be able to finish them.

speaker: Claude
text: Looks like we made it through the madhouse. So where's this treasure that Rhea mentioned?

speaker: Claude
text: We finally found it. This must be...the treasure? Let's get out of here and take a look.

speaker: Seteth
text: Allow me to apologize, on Rhea's behalf, for putting you so squarely in harm's way. That much force should not have been necessary to deter mere thieves. Perhaps, in her haste, Rhea made a miscalculation.

speaker: Byleth
text: What kind of trap was that?

speaker: Byleth
text: Did Rhea really build all that?

speaker: Seteth
text: It is a little-known legend that the Holy Tomb was constructed by the goddess herself. That mirage, those guardians--I believe that trap was there from the beginning. It must have been disabled for the sake of the ceremony the last time you were there. Now, as to this treasure we've uncovered... This is an ancient Relic, blessed by the goddess and kept sacred by the Church. It is both a priceless piece of history and a holy artifact of extraordinary power. Rhea has entrusted it to you, and you may do with it as you wish. But please treat it with the utmost care.

speaker: Seteth
text: Well, I suppose that concludes this bit of business. I shall take my leave.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I never thought a Holy Tomb would have a trap such as that. Had we not been prepared... Yet, if Lady Rhea set that trap, then what kind of person is she?

speaker: Byleth
text: A goddess, maybe?

speaker: Byleth
text: A genius, maybe?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Perhaps you could go save Lady Rhea and ask her directly. Whatever the truth, still this treasure has been recovered. I do not know how much history is attached to this item, but it is an amazing artifact. It is possible this weapon once engraved its name in the history of the Church of Seiros. This is your responsibility, emparted to you by Lady Rhea. You must decide how best to make use of it.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I will be going now. I must prepare for our next battle.

speaker: Claude
text: Good grief! Rhea's trap was more extensive than I expected. Could something like that really be a result of sorcery alone? I don't understand the structure at all... It certainly wasn't made quickly.

speaker: Byleth
text: Was it made earlier?

speaker: Byleth
text: What it there from the beginning?

speaker: Claude
text: I think so. That trap may have been built into the Holy Tomb when it was first constructed. In which case, there might have been another purpose for building it, other than just as a saint's tomb... Now I have even more questions for Rhea. I hope we reunite with her soon. However, we now have a salvaged treasure... It might be something incredible... The church kept some of the legendary weapons that were blessed by the goddess. This isn't something one just stumbles across. Anyway, it was entrusted to you, Teach. Do what you will with it.

speaker: Claude
text: My curiosity has been satisfied for the time being, so maybe I'll return to my responsibilities...

speaker: Leonie
text: Not bad at all, if I do say so myself.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I see needles and thread. What has you engaging in the textile arts, Leonie?

speaker: Leonie
text: Patching up a hole in my equipment bag. Take a look. What do you think?

speaker: Linhardt
text: If your objective is merely to block up the hole, then I believe you've performed quite adequate work.

speaker: Byleth
text: You might need a new one.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm not going to throw away something I can still use. I can't afford to be wasteful.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe you should ask for help next time.

speaker: Leonie
text: Blocking the hole was all I cared about, so this suits me just fine.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes, but your bag is less bag and more a collection of dirty, smelly patches.

speaker: Leonie
text: Smelly, huh? I don't smell anything.

speaker: Linhardt
text: That aside, don't you have an allowance from your house to make purchases?

speaker: Leonie
text: No, nothing. Worse than that, actually. I'm in debt. I could only afford the Officers Academy because everyone in my village donated.

speaker: Byleth
text: The tuition is that expensive?

speaker: Leonie
text: It's not just that. In the Alliance, you have to pay the nobles as well in order to secure recommendations. Commoners can only get an education by borrowing money. It's pretty stupid. Not sure what makes the nobles think they've got the right to– Oh, sorry, Linhardt. Forgot you're a noble.

speaker: Linhardt
text: If one is in a family that bears a Crest, then you're going to stand atop the social pecking order. I'd raise the topic with the goddess. She handed out Crests to the nobles after all.

speaker: Leonie
text: Just handed them out, huh? You make it sound pretty casual.

speaker: Linhardt
text: By the way, I have a weapon to recommend. It should suit a commoner such as yourself.

speaker: Leonie
text: That so? I just told you I don't have a lot of money.

speaker: Linhardt
text: You're not going to buy it from a merchant. If you find it, you can keep it for free.

speaker: Leonie
text: Now you've got my attention.

speaker: Linhardt
text: There's a legend I read recently about Saint Indech, one of the Four Saints of the Church of Seiros.

speaker: Leonie
text: Uh-huh? Keep talking.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Sorry... Suddenly very sleepy. Nap time calls.

speaker: Leonie
text: Hey, come on! You can't just doze off in the middle of a story!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Long story short, there's a holy weapon hidden in Lake Teutates that you can use even without a Crest...

speaker: Leonie
text: Lake Teutates? Right. Let's go, Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: Me?

speaker: Leonie
text: What's with that look? Don't you want to help your lovely students?

speaker: Byleth
text: Lovely?

speaker: Leonie
text: Yeah. Me and Linhardt. Aren't we just the cutest?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Leave me be. I'm off to nap.

speaker: Leonie
text: We'll never find it unless you're there. If you're really that tired, we'll just have to carry you.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure I want to carry him.

speaker: Leonie
text: We'll bring more people. We'll take turns. Come on, Professor. You're coming, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: I will.

speaker: Linhardt
text: If we're going now, I do suggest leaving Edelgard and Hubert innocent of our quest. Lake Teutates is a place that concerns the saints of the Church of Seiros. It may become bothersome should the two of them find out...

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm not fond of keeping secrets from friends, but I guess we can tell them when we get back.

speaker: Leonie
text: All right, let's go find this thing!

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe later.

speaker: Leonie
text: Ah, well. Guess it's just you and me, Linhardt.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Zzz...

speaker: Leonie
text: Let me know if you change your mind, Professor. Looks like I might be waiting here a bit.

speaker: Leonie
text: Linhardt! Wake up! We've reached Lake Teutates!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Huh? What? Oh, um. Yes. So we have.

speaker: Leonie
text: A temple on a lake, huh? Looks fancy. And that's a cute...uh...guard dog?

speaker: The Immovable
text: Guard dog? Is it I to whom you are referring?

speaker: Leonie
text: Whoa! A magic beast! And it talks!

speaker: The Immovable
text: Nuisance... You weaklings should turn tail and run!

speaker: Leonie
text: Uh, hi! We're actually, um, looking for something...

speaker: The Immovable
text: I know well what it is that you desire. If you want it, you must first complete my trial.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Of course we do. This is as awful as I expected. Perhaps we could go home now?

speaker: Leonie
text: Are you kidding? It's just a little fog! Come on, let's go talk to Mr. Magic Beast!

speaker: Linhardt
text: I suspect our opponent is an illusion. If we cut off the source of this magic, they should stop attacking.

speaker: The Immovable
text: Fine. Defeat me, and show me what you are capable of!

speaker: The Immovable
text: Could you be the incarnation of Sothis? Interesting... Let's test your mettle!

speaker: Linhardt
text: We'll fight, but your form and mannerisms suggest that you might be...

speaker: The Immovable
text: If you want your wish to be granted, it is better that you fight me in ignorance.

speaker: Leonie
text: Hey, Mr. Magic Beast! If we defeat you, will you grant our wish?

speaker: The Immovable
text: Indeed, I will.

speaker: Leonie
text: Great! I may not have a Crest, but I'll give it my all!

speaker: The Immovable
text: You are an interesting young girl... I accept your challenge.

speaker: Seteth
text: You seem to be holding back. Thank you for that.

speaker: The Immovable
text: Hmph. Do not flatter me. My power is not what it once was. The best I can do nowadays is to have fun meddling with humans who wander in here.

speaker: Seteth
text: I see. We were hoping you might help us, but is seems that may be too difficult.

speaker: The Immovable
text: Oh! You're here too! I've always wanted to meet you, Ceth–

speaker: Flayn
text: I ask that you keep quiet, Uncle!

speaker: The Immovable
text: What's that? Ceth–

speaker: Flayn
text: Shh! Please keep quiet, Uncle!

speaker: The Immovable
text: You did well. The trial ends here... What sublime children of men... Go ahead. Name your desire.

speaker: Leonie
text: So, uh, we heard you're giving away free weapons?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Do be quiet, Leonie. Somewhere in this temple is said to rest the holy bow of Saint Indech. It is called "the Inexhaustible." Could you find it in your heart to let my friend here have it?

speaker: The Immovable
text: You have shown might deserving of my sacred bow. I will grant your wish.

speaker: Leonie
text: Yes! Thanks, Mr. Magic Beast!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Aren't you happy, Leonie? That's quite a bow, and it was completely free.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'll say. I've never seen anything like it. But is it really OK for me to take this?

speaker: Linhardt
text: I would say so, wouldn't you? After all, you went through an awful lot to get it.

speaker: Leonie
text: I know, but... Professor, maybe you should hold on to it for me. At least for a while.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's yours, Leonie.

speaker: Leonie
text: It's not a weapon just anyone can use. I can see that. I want to be more confident in my strength before I really call it my own. Even holding it right now makes me feel unworthy. I'd really appreciate you looking after it for me.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand.

speaker: Leonie
text: Thanks, Professor. And everyone else who helped me too. I'm really grateful. Linhardt, I'm sorry I forced you to come along. But seeing such a kind-hearted person like you... Well, let's just say my opinion of the nobility's shifted a bit.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I'm not sure I completely understand, Leonie, but it sounds like praise, so I will take it as such.

speaker: Leonie
text: Now, let's get back to work! I need all the training I can get!

speaker: Linhardt
text: She already possessed the strength to use that bow... She went through the trouble of fighting a saint so she could claim that weapon as her own.

speaker: Byleth
text: A saint?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Or maybe you'd call it a saintly beast. In any case...

speaker: Linhardt
text: When the time is right, can you fill in Edelgard about what happened?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Oh, and please do let me use that bow. It's not exactly a Hero's Relic, but it is still rather fascinating, isn't it? I would love to learn to what extent the bow's connection to the Crest influences the weapon and perhaps even... Oh, it's been too much of a day, hasn't it? I'm feeling tired, so let's talk about this later. Good night.

speaker: Caspar
text: Professor! Mercedes! What are you two doing here?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Um, we were just talking. Why do you look so flustered?

speaker: Caspar
text: Haven't you heard? An Imperial army was spotted near Garreg Mach!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh. Do you think they came to scout?

speaker: Caspar
text: Maybe? We could probably take care of 'em if that's the case... But I heard the Death Knight is out there!

speaker: Mercedes
text: The Death Knight...

speaker: Byleth
text: Is that a problem?

speaker: Byleth
text: Who was that again?

speaker: Caspar
text: Don't you remember? He's the guy who abducted Flayn! We fought him a bunch of times after that! Right, Mercedes? Oh. Is something the matter?

speaker: Mercedes
text: N-No. It's nothing. Really... Now's probably not the time, but I was just thinking of my brother.

speaker: Caspar
text: You have a brother?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Yes, but we have different fathers. He was a year younger than me.

speaker: Caspar
text: Why'd he suddenly come to mind?

speaker: Mercedes
text: You see--

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Quickly! You must prepare for battle! The Death Knight has been spotted in the Sealed Forest! He only has a few troops with him, so we planned on taking him out with just the knights, but... We can't guarantee that reinforcements won't arrive. We would appreciate your backup, just in case.

speaker: Mercedes
text: The Death Knight... I have to go...

speaker: Caspar
text: Mercedes, wait! I don't know what's going on with you, but...

speaker: Mercedes
text: No! I have to go see him!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go with her.

speaker: Caspar
text: Yeah, we can't let him get away! I'll help Mercedes find the Death Knight! You go gather the others and meet up with us, Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not so sure...

speaker: Caspar
text: We don't really have time to sit around and think, but a little prep can't hurt against the Death Knight.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Yes... You two are right...

speaker: Caspar
text: Let me know when you're ready. Try not to take too long though, all right? It's not like the Death Knight is just gonna wander around the forest waiting for us to find him.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Emile, wait! Don't go! Take your helmet of. Please. Let me see your face. It really is you under there, isn't it? I've been searching for so long...

speaker: Caspar
text: I finally caught up with you, Mercedes. You're faster than you look... But I'm here now, so you can give up, Death Knight!

speaker: Death Knight
text: Flee, and I will not chase you... Challenge me, and I will have no choice but to fight...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Enemy reinforcements are approaching! What should we do?

speaker: Caspar
text: Let's take 'em out! Reinforcements just means we get to fight even more!

speaker: Death Knight
text: I told you that if you fled, I would not chase you. But it seems you wish to die...

speaker: Mercedes
text: You try to hide yourself with that mask and helmet...But I know who you really are.

speaker: Death Knight
text: I...have nothing to say to you.

speaker: Caspar
text: The Infamous Death Knight! Champion of the Empire! Taking you down is gonna be satisfying.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Heh. Simpleton...

speaker: Death Knight
text: Fate is unkind. There will be no resolution today... Flee, and I will not give chase.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Simple...but effective...

speaker: Caspar
text: You're not getting away that easy!

speaker: Death Knight
text: I must go...

speaker: Caspar
text: Phew...we did it. Are you all right, Mercedes?

speaker: Mercedes
text: I am, thanks to you. But still...

speaker: Caspar
text: There's something you wanted to ask him, right? Come on, he ran off into the forest.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Thank you, Caspar.

speaker: Death Knight
text: You came...

speaker: Mercedes
text: How many years has it been since we last spoke? I'm so sorry... I should have come for you sooner... I'm sure it wasn't pleasant living in House Bartels.

speaker: Caspar
text: I'm not sure I follow. Do you know this guy, Mercedes?

speaker: Mercedes
text: My younger brother... Emile... Is it really you?

speaker: Caspar
text: I'm sorry, what? Your brother is the Death Knight?! But you two look nothing alike!

speaker: Death Knight
text: Mercedes... Leave the monastery.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hold on just a minute! Is that all you've got to say for yourself?

speaker: Death Knight
text: This doesn't concern you...

speaker: Caspar
text: That's not true! You're her brother, right? But you've got nothing nice to say to her after all this time?

speaker: Death Knight
text: You will die...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Even if I die, I've made my choice. Please, Emile. Fight on our side instead.

speaker: Death Knight
text: I cannot. My soul has long departed... And yet... Here. Take this and go.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Is this...a Hero's Relic? You and I must share the same Crest.

speaker: Death Knight
text: When next we meet, I will kill you without hesitation.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You won't kill me. I have this now.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Hmph. Do not die until I can kill you...

speaker: Death Knight
text: Hmph.

speaker: Caspar
text: What is it? You got a problem with me?

speaker: Death Knight
text: Take... this...

speaker: Caspar
text: This is...

speaker: Death Knight
text: I will kill her. Until then, she must live...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Emile! I can't believe he's gone again...

speaker: Caspar
text: I can't tell whether or not he actually cares that you're his sister...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm... Somewhere, hiding underneath that helmet, there's a very sweet boy.

speaker: Caspar
text: Is that a joke? Would a sweet boy threaten to kill someone? I don't get you, Mercedes.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Living at House Bartels changed him. But that's beside the point. Thank you, Caspar. I couldn't have confronted him without you.

speaker: Caspar
text: Don't worry about it. I may not understand you half the time, but we're still pals.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Come on then, pal. Let's get back to everyone else.
